general.headline: Workplace Relations Management and Consultancy / Property Development and Construction Management

jobs.description:
Property development projects in the state of New South Wales with a particular focus
      
      on projects in the Sydney metropolitan area.

My role involved leading a group of Human Resources and Industrial Relations professionals whose roles were to provide support and advice across the CBA Group on a range of workplace issues. 

My team was split into three areas: Workplace Relations Advice, Workplace Relations Policy and Workplace Grievance Review (WGR). 

A breakdown of the roles of each of the teams that I led is provided below: 

Workplace Relations Advice - The Workplace Relations Advice team provided operational industrial relations and human resources advice across the entire CBA Group including running workshops on a range of employment related topics. This included but was not limited to advice on matters such as performance management, misconduct, personal illness, discrimination/harassment or dispute resolution. The team also provided support in matters where third parties become involved such as the Finance Sector Union (FSU), Industrial Officers or Solicitors, and they represented the Group in Industrial Tribunals, Commissions and or Courts. The team was also responsible for monitoring the industrial relations landscape across the CBA Group. 

Workplace Relations Policy – The main functions of this team was to manage, design, research, analyse and advise on the Group’s workplace policies. This involved but was not limited to the drafting of new policies and reviewing existing policies.

Workplace Grievance Review - WGR provided an avenue for individuals to formally raise a workplace issue that they consider might adversely or unfairly affect them. WGR helped to ensure that the Group continued to provide all individuals with an opportunity to come to work where they would be fairly treated.

My role also included directly negotiating the Group's Enterprise Agreements as well as advising on and resolving matters and disputes at a very senior level across the Group.

I also ran presentations and workshops on successful leadership and was a mentor to numerous employees across the Group.

general.description:
I have a strong background in people management, strategy, analytics, risk management as well as project and change management within the IT environment.  I have 9 years of experience in the financial services industry and have worked for Standard Bank and Commonwealth Bank of Australia.  I have recently completed my MBA through the Gordon Institute of Business Sciences and was able to develop my leadership and strategic capabilities as a result as well as through the leadership of various teams.

I am a hard working, motivated, driven and results orientated person.  I have a passion for innovation and working in an agile fashion focussing on design thinking and ideation principles.  I am able to work in a team environment both as a leader and a participating member.  I have led various teams with responsibility for a multitude of activities from IT, Strategy, Budgets, scenario analysis and quantitative risk analysis.  I want to understand banking in its entirety and have had the opportunity to work in various areas within the bank as well in different jurisdictions.  I like to challenge the way things are currently being done and to try and improve them so as to perform more effectively and efficiently.  I have had experience in setting strategy as well as executing it and have been able to redirect various teams in order to ensure delivery in line with business expectations and goals.

I have dual citizenship (South African and German) and love to travel and explore the world.  I have had the opportunity to work in multiple countries and this has enhanced my appreciation for diversity in culture and problem solving in a multinational organisation as well as afforded me the opportunity to manage diverse teams.

jobs.description:
I lead a small dynamic Operational Risk Analytics team responsible for the creation of various productivity and decision making initiatives aimed at using analytics, data visualisation and big data to manage risk more effectively and increase self management and accountability amongst business owners of Operational Risk. Creating a clear strategy and vision for data led decision making is a core part of the role.

Using analytics along with Agile methodologies, Design Thinking and Ideation the team I lead aims to produce tools that will support the business owners of risk as well as the risk practitioners to more effectively and efficiently manage their operational and compliance risk. Through data visualisation and the use of easy to use interfaces we can also help the business to understand key data quality areas of improvement. The use of analytics further enables the prioritisation of risk assessments and control testing, automation of residual risk assessments and greater insights and risk awareness.

Ensuring the right tools and IT infrastructure is in place to support the development of insightful analytics is a key component of my role as is a focus on proper data management principles, data security and governance from my experience with BCBS239.

general.headline: Global speaker, success coach, facilitator, creator,  founding director at Who Am I Projects and author of Read Me First.
general.description:
Lisa challenges the status quo. You’ll find her curiosity captivating – so much so that you’ll be well out of your comfort zone before you even realise you were on your way.  You know they say the harder you work the luckier you get? Lisa Stephenson is one of the lucky ones. Lisa knows how to hit the mark. She looks beyond the obvious, peeling apart the layers by asking the right questions at the right time. She makes the connections, builds the relationships, digging deeper and aiming higher.  As the founding Director of Who Am I Projects, Lisa successfully combines accreditations, skills and experience with an incredible sense of curiosity, intuition and compassion. She’s also a diehard 80’s fan (don’t judge), although she doesn’t mind the occasional 90’s rock (and, naturally, is totally obsessed with Adele). 
After starting her career with a Bachelor of Arts in Management Communication and a Certificate IV in Workplace Assessment & Training, Lisa graduated from the renowned Life Coaching Academy. She became driven to combine all three disciplines, guiding and supporting people to be the very best version of themselves, both professionally and personally.

Lisa’s book Read Me First is now available www.readmefirst.com.au

jobs.description:
Lisa and her team specialise in working with individuals and organisations on learning projects that have at their core talent development, executive coaching, corporate ‘storytelling’, networking events and ‘stretch’ experiences.  The greatest learning happens in discomfort!

As a keynote speaker, Lisa works across Australia, Asia, N.Z and the U.S.  Setting the challenge for audiences around the world, in understanding you are your most important project.  

Of note, Lisa has developed and managed the highly regarded THRIVE talent development experience for the National Australia Bank over the past 8 years (Australia and Asia), as well as Telstra’s THE DYNAMIC talent development experience, Treasury Wine Estate’s VERAISON program, and Macquarie Bank’s SHINE experience for women in banking. Also of note is the leadership work delivered for Australian Unity.  There lots of work we can that the team can't tell you about! 

Her passion lies in supporting people to be the best version of themselves, and to achieve their best life in a holistic way. She will engage, challenge, inspire, and hold people accountable for going after what they want! People are taken to that higher level of achievement where they will know what they didn’t know before and will start acting on that gap between where they are and where they want to be. They will know more about what success (and happiness) means for them and what they need to do to achieve it.

Many will testify that Lisa’s approach is informal and intuitive.  She works with great passion and warmth, and with a strong commitment to results. Her workshops and 'projects' are relevant, high impact and fun.  Lisa has built a strong brand around her trusting and robust client relationships.  Clients will be happy to testify not only to how much she cares, but also how she tells the truth, provides meaningful feedback and takes pleasure in asking the powerful questions they haven’t even thought of yet.

Natasha is Chief Executive and Partner of OnTalent, an exciting venture launched with former Manpower Colleague Varina Nissen.  OnTalent specialises in Executive and specialist recruitment with a focus on robust assessment of both competence and fit - 'connecting people to purpose'.

OnTalent has quickly emerged as a firm of choice for organisations looking for exemplary customer service and creative solutions to sourcing at the most senior levels.
Natasha has more than 20 years recruitment industry experience  and is a successful consultant in the executive, NFP and newly formed strategic positions.  For the past 15 years she held senior management and leadership positions both nationally and state based. 

Natasha began her career with PricewaterhouseCoopers where she spent nearly six years providing executive recruitment to clients of the firm as well as providing recruitment and workforce planning to the firm for major projects and key executive internal roles.  Her experience included leading teams in group assessments, executive placement and psychometric assessment before moving to Deloitte as Director of their Queensland Resources practice.  

Wanting to diversify her career Natasha spent nearly 2 years as an Executive Search consultant with a well known boutique firm specializing in Executive Search in the Executive and specialist engineering sectors before leading a large Commercial recruitment team for a national recruitment player.

Natasha enjoys developing the capability of her team and drives the highest professional standards.  She is recognised as a Fellow of the RCSA and contributes as Vice Chair of the Qld/NT Council.

Specialties: Leadership, leading the appointment of critical 'for purpose' roles, finding talent for new strategic directions.

jobs.description:
Foodbank Queensland is a non-denominational community supported, non-profit organisation which relies on the support of a large network of dedicated people who have a commitment to fulfilling the aims and objectives of Foodbank Queensland. 

The concept of Foodbank Queensland is simple – to feed the country’s needy by redistributing surplus food. 

Food growers, manufacturers and processors produce quantities of food which, for various commercial reasons, cannot be sold. The products may be incorrectly labelled, have faulty packaging, be part of a trial run or are not produced to exact specifications. 

It is estimated that as much as 30% of all food produced is unsaleable for a variety of reasons. 

Increasingly, welfare agencies are involved in an on-going struggle to provide food relief to thousands of people who are dependant on food handouts to supplement their welfare benefits. 

Foodbank Queensland is the link between these two groups. Foodbank provides an outlet to food companies for their surplus stock and at the same time, allows community support agencies to save time and resources in the solicitation of nutritious food.
Queensland's largest not for profit food rescue charity

Since I can remember, I was always building & fixing things. Creating magnificent structures from cardboard boxes, sticky tape & household items. Using whatever I could find to manifest the creation in my mind. In return, I was awarded the nickname, “The A-Team”, by my father.

Today, I use the same curiosity, creativity and problem solving ability to help big & small organisations transform in to digital, innovative & customer centric businesses. I set the strategy, negotiate investment, and then deliver, by building new capability and running the transformational change needed to achieve business outcomes.

Through my strategic and systemic thinking, coupled with design thinking, Lean & Agile methodologies, I have achieved lasting transformations and more effective operational delivery. general.headline: Author of The Purpose Project | Chief Purpose Activator/Educator | Conscious Capitalist | Certified B Corp
general.description:
How do you keep your best people, fill them with energy and enthusiasm and create a mentally healthy and happy workplace? By giving them a sense of meaning and purpose - a reason to come to work beyond the pay packet.

Carolyn Tate & Co. is an education and publishing company dedicated to unearthing a higher purpose in people and organisations. Carolyn believes that the purpose of business is to serve the greater good and that profit should be the by-product, not the single-minded goal.

Carolyn is an ex-marketer with a passion for purpose-digging, writing, speaking, teaching and community building. As a brand and marketing specialist with a 20-year history at Westpac, Merrill Lynch and with over 16 years running her own businesses, she is uniquely placed to help any company dedicated to building a “profit-for-purpose” entity.

She is the author of five books including Conscious Marketing (2015) and The Purpose Project (2017). Her mission is to support the worlds leaders to become 'Stewards of Purpose' for their own lives, for their people, for their organisation and the world-at-large. She does this through The Purpose Project Train the Trainer program.

Carolyn believes we can all bring our own why to work, starting right where we are, no matter where we work.

Discover more about The Purpose Project and her Train the Trainer programs and events at www.carolyntate.co, email carolyn@carolyntate.co or phone +61 412 806 950.

jobs.description:
Carolyn Tate & Co. is an education and publishing company dedicated to unearthing a higher purpose in people and organisations. Carolyn believes that the purpose of business is to serve the greater good and that profit should be the by-product, not the single-minded goal.

Our why: To unearth a higher purpose in people and organisations.

Carolyn is an ex-marketer with a passion for purpose-digging, writing, speaking, teaching and community building. As a brand and marketing specialist with a 20-year history at Westpac, Merrill Lynch and with over 16 years running her own businesses, she is uniquely placed to help any company dedicated to building a “profit-for-purpose” entity.

Carolyn is the author of Small Business Big Brand (2007), Marketing Your Small Business for Dummies (2010), Unstuck in Provence (2013, a personal memoir), Conscious Marketing (2015) and The Purpose Project: A handbook for bringing meaning to life at work. (2017).

She was the founder of The Slow School of Business (Slow School) and Talk on Purpose programs.

Underpinning all her work is a commitment to being courageous, growing in consciousness, operating with compassion and connecting authentically with others in the spirit of collaboration. The company is a Certified B Corporation and Carolyn is a founding member of Conscious Capitalism Australia.

Slow School is a people powered learning community dedicated to building purpose-driven and prosperous businesses that make the world a better place.

The community is made up of independent educators, facilitators and professionals who come together to co-create customised learning & development programs for companies. All programs such as the flagship program, Talk on Purpose, are highly experiential and transformative.

We host regular dinners, classes and events to bring together entrepreneurs, employees, schools, academics and government workers.  

Why ‘slow’? In a world where fast-profit and short-term thinking dominate, the slow movement advocates a shift towards slowing down. It’s an ideology that espouses that fast is not better, and that a conscious and mindful approach yields better results.

For three years I worked at Merrill Lynch in marketing management roles working on

As a leading Brand and Profile Strategist, international keynote speaker and published writer, I offer 25 years’ experience delivering award-winning strategies for iconic and international brands. 

Now, as Founder and Director of Brand True North, I position client profiles for high credibility and trust to deliver invaluable media exposure and prestigious business awards. 

As a passionate and results driven connector and storyteller, I create strong connections between people and brands, expertise, experiences, concepts, inspiration and ideas. 

Holding long-term Senior Management roles driving brand strategy for Leo Burnett, Subaru, JC Penny, Acer, Foxtel, CommSec and, Commonwealth Bank, I now specialise in working with influential business leaders, business owners, entrepreneurs and corporate career leaders to create business and personal brand strategies, positioning and community building for growth and impact. 

Trained by LinkedIn for LinkedIn Social Selling, I was part of the strategic team to deliver and implement the successful CommBank Social Selling Program for 500 Business Bankers over 5 years - I'm consistently ranked in the top 1% for my industry and network across LinkedIn.   

With a flair and passion for entrepreneurial business, I use Design Thinking Methodology and an authentic customer lens to strategically position and align brands with their ideal audiences and drive growth through brand storytelling.

With valuable negotiation skills and business acumen, I’ve also run successful small businesses (with both a corporate and retail client base) and have fruitful leadership and team management experience. 

My solid understanding of financial products and services is supported by Securities & Managed Investments Accreditation from Deakin University.

jobs.description:
Over the last 5 years business has changed…

Faster internet speeds, the rise of e-commerce, the social media revolution, Google dominance, global outsourcing, mobile apps, marketing automation tools, cloud computing and much more have altered the way businesses are run daily.

All these changes have meant business has been turned upside down. Many businesses that were once infallible are now struggling or broke. While others have seemingly come from nowhere and are now dominating their industry, making millions.

So, yes, business has changed, but most business education companies haven’t. They are still teaching principles from the past that are based on old and out-dated strategies.

Enter Business Blueprint®, the world’s most forward-thinking business training company. Founded in 2010 by award-winning entrepreneur Dale Beaumont, our mission is to simplify success and help you to build a profitable business that gives you the lifestyle you want.

To do this we train you in the latest cutting-edge marketing strategies and show you how to use technology to automate your business and dramatically increase your profit.

Find out more about how we can help you: http://bburl.co/52ways1

Beau's ability to engage and influence people with his energy and passion has led him to working with one of Australia’s most dynamic serial entrepreneurs, Creel Price on Club Kidpreneur. This organisation runs programs teaching Young Australians aged between 8-12 years about entrepreneurship.

In the program Beau worked to guide these young entrepreneurs through a simple step-by-step process that they could use to start their own business regardless of their age, gave them perspective on business and the value of money, helped kids consider entrepreneurial endeavors as a career choice and encouraged kids to be inspired, informed and involved in micro business ventures.

Club Kidpreneur Foundation, a social enterprise committed to helping young people start and grow their own micro-enterprises and to inspiring a career in entrepreneurship.

Our aim is to foster entrepreneurial behaviour in kids in order to:

* Enhance their initiative, responsibility and their ability to learn from mistakes
* Give perspective on business and the value of money
* Have kids consider entrepreneurial endeavour as a career choice
* Encourage kids to be inspired, informed and involved  in micro-business ventures

Hands Across the Water is an Australian charity that gives at-risk Thai children and their communities a helping hand. Our projects are tailored to meet local communities’ needs – for the long term. The work we do is focused on improving the lives of the kids and their communities today and in the future.

In 2004, countless Thai children were left alone and homeless by the Boxing Day tsunami.

Hands founder, former police forensic specialist Peter Baines, OAM working with the tsunami disaster victim identification team, was deeply touched by the number of children left homeless and alone by the natural disaster. He was inspired to establish an organisation that could make a real difference.
In late 2005, a team of committed individuals with the desire to help others formed Hands Across The Water.

We initially supported 32 kids who had lost their parents and were living in a tent at Baan Tharn Namchai (BTN) in Phang-Nga, a town on Thailand’s northern Andaman coast. The kids were left without food, shelter or support.
Hands, along with a number of equally committed supporters pooled their resources to build the first orphanage at Baan Tharn Namchai. Our director, Khun Rotjana, led the centre and it was opened in August 2006.
Today, Baan Tharn Namchai is home to 85 children.
Hands today
We support hundreds of children in multiple locations across Thailand: 

   * Baan Tharn Namchai at Khao Lak
   * Home Hug at Yasothon
   * Home Hug at Surin
   * The New Life Project at Kanchanaburi
   * The New Life Project at Chumphon
   * Baan Nam Khem community centre and tsunami refuge at Khao Lak
   * PAMA House at Chanthaburi (under development)

Sprouting Good is an Australian Charity that run by a passionate team dedicated to changing the way society treats our Environment & Homeless Youth. We take our food supply for granted simply by just heading in to a supermarket & selecting the things we wish to eat or take our fancy. Take a moment to think about how & what we are actually being delivered & who is controlling our food supplies.

The selection of Fresh Fruit & Vegetable available in your local supermarket is decided based on financial viability of the company. The selection has to be hardy & durable so it survives transport rather then what actually has the best taste. When picked the Fresh Fruit & Vegetable could be stored in Cold Storage before being transported either Domestically or Internationally for hundreds of kilometers before actually reaching the shelf and your plate. Therefore the Fresh fruit that you are putting in to your body could have been picked months prior to you purchasing it. Now argument is that this has been happening for many years & this is true to some extent.

Upgrades in technology means that they have been able to extend the lifespan of the Fruit & Vegetables using chemicals that are considered harmless for humans to consume however are really still too young to know the full effects that they may have on our heart, soul & minds. Although we are told these are safe chemicals and do not effect the produce in any way we need to take some responsibilities of what we put in to our bodies & make a conscious decision to look after ourselves the best we can.

Sprouting Good Rooftop farms are organic & due to our local positions we are able to deliver fresh fruit & vegetables to suppliers with minimal time from Harvest. People question about particles in the air effecting the crops but as the pollution that can effect our produce weighs more then air they are found at ground level not in the air around our farms giving us the opportunity to provide food excellence.

The program has been proven to assist entrepreneurs in accelerating the growth of their business revenue, systemisation, exit strategies and business valuation, raising capital, acquiring businesses, increasing market share, driving profitability and enhancing the net worth of the entrepreneur.

Petar Lackovic is the CEO of MBE Group and has been advising business for over 15 years and increasing their net worth. Petar has generated over 1 Billion Dollars worth of sale for himself and his clients and is renown as being Australia’s leading sales expert and strategist.

Accelerate the growth of your business, Increase profitability, Establish strategic partnerships that will drive you business, Develop a brand that consistently appeals to your consumers, Gain massive exposure and drive your personal credibility through use of PR, Significantly de‐risk your business making it attractive for acquisition and to one day exit, Decrease your personal involvement in your business through systemisation and effective leadership, Increase the valuation of your business, Raise capital or make acquisitions where suitable Identify and Execute peripheral growth opportunities.

general.headline: Founder and CEO at DRC - Care Solutions
general.description:
I find the best quality care options for my clients.

Navigating the services offered in aged, disability and home care is difficult. I take the time, stress and pain out of the process by finding the most appropriate care for my clients, be they the care recipient or responsible guardian.

Guardians typically spend three to five weeks searching for appropriate care. This includes research, interviews, site inspections, and liaison with the care recipient’s financial planner, accountant, lawyer, doctor and social worker. For a set fee, I do the work for you.

My services extend beyond private clients to corporates. To strengthen their position as “Employers of Choice”, companies retain me to provide one-on-one advice for employees juggling work and their role as a guardian.

With more than three decades of experience in the Australian aged, disability and home care sector, I have an intimate knowledge of the options available and personally know many of the business owners and leaders in the industry.

In addition to finding quality care options for clients, I advise senior managers, CEOs and Directors in the care industry on policy and process improvement, and I speak on these topics at major conferences.

I also appear in the Supreme, District and Family Courts as a medico-legal expert witness on the cost of care for people who are orphaned or have sustained permanent injuries as a result of work-related accidents, motor vehicle accident and negligence.

Specialties: Finding care solutions for private clients; Retained by corporates to find care solutions for employees who are carers; Adviser on policy and process improvement in the care industry; Medico-legal expert witness; Conference speaker; Entrepreneur.

jobs.description:
Care 360 is Australia’s only comprehensive, independent comparison site enabling quick and easy assessment of every aged care option based on its merits and an individual’s specific needs. 

Caring | Comprehensive | Conflict-free

Founded on Australia's most comprehensive set of relevant data, powered by a robust algorithm and supported offline by expert advisers, Care 360 has been designed to maximise convenience, efficiency and accuracy. Because our goal is to fundamentally remove stress for care-seekers, we have removed any potential conflicts by remaining 100% independent of all care solution suppliers. 

Partnering with expert advisers from supporting service industries such as legal and financial advisory, we ensure care seekers benefit from a full 360-degree view of the entire landscape of challenges and solution options. It’s an elegantly simple solution to a complex problem, and a complete step change for the industry.

Care360 is a B2B tool which is now available on a subscription basis to expert providers such as financial advisers, accountants, lawyers and health service providers who will be able to add significant value to Aussies facing these decisions. 

You can learn more at www.care360.com.au

Across Australia, we personally help you find quality care whether you are seeking the care yourself or you are the responsible guardian.

We reduce the time it takes to find the most appropriate care and we take away the stress of finding urgent care and assistance, particularly where the guardian is based overseas.

Consumers have the choice of having public or private care assessments. As a private care assessor, DRC can fast track your access to care services, including home care packages.

If you are an employee, check whether your employer retains our services as you may be subsidised under our Corporate Care Concierge Package.

http://www.daniellerobertson.com.au  http://www.drccaresolutions.com

Honoured to lead the NSW / ACT Chapter of Family Business Australia in 2017 as well
      
      as contributing to the future of FBA as a member of the National Board.

We consult to businesses providing aged, disability and home care. We improve their processes, drive business development and improve the experience of their customers.

Conference organisers in the care industry and related professions of financial planning and estate planning regularly call on us to speak at major conferences.

Barristers rely on us as medico-legal expert witnesses in court actions. We provide evidence on the cost of care involved for people who are orphaned or who have sustained permanent disabilities.

http://www.daniellerobertson.com.au

Dial-An-Angel is Australia’s only national agency specialised in providing aged, home and childcare. In leading the business, Danielle managed 50 full-time staff and 7,500 carers.

Over her 12 years at the helm, she increased the annual revenue of business by 5% year on year and navigated the business through National Disability Insurance Scheme and Consumer Directed Care accreditation.

As a business leader in the sector, Danielle lobbied government on behalf of consumers on a number of issues, including the cost of in-home care. In 2012, she helped establish the Australian Nanny Association to bring professionalism to the nanny industry.

In this role, Danielle put in place the policies, systems and procedures that
      subsequently took the company from a family business structure to a national
      
      enterprise.

At a time of substantial growth for the company, Danielle managed its cash flow and
      forecasted growth. During this time, staff numbers increased 50% and the number of
      
      contracted carers tripled.

general.headline: Founder - Xplore for Success, AFR Woman of Influence 2018
general.description:
Diana Ryall is a leading voice and advocate for Gender Equality in Australia. She promotes women achieving their career aspirations, and challenges men to examine their assumptions about women and their careers.

In 2002, Diana founded Xplore for Success, a boutique consultancy specialising in supporting professionals to achieve career and personal success. Over the past 16 years, more that 15,000 women and men have benefited from Xplore’s career development programs, including participants from organisations including American Express, CBA, Lend Lease, NAB, NSW Trains and Suncorp.

In January 2010, Diana became a Member of the Order of Australia, AM, for her significant contribution to the education community, her commitment  to the advancement of women, and her ongoing and wide-reaching charitable work.

Diana is committed to a number of charitable and philanthropic causes. She is an Ambassador for Honour a Woman, Good Return and Dress for Success Sydney. She sits on the Industry Advisory Group for Victorian Police. As a breast cancer survivor, she supports the National Breast Cancer Foundation, and is a key spokesperson for International Women’s Day. Diana also mentors a number of businesswomen and entrepreneurs from around Australia.
 
From 1997 to 2001, Diana was Managing Director of Apple Australia and, while at the helm, won the the annual ‘Employer of the Year’ Award. Diana joined Apple in 1983 and rose from a part-time training position through sales, marketing, business development and government relations positions before becoming Managing Director.

From 2006 to 2009, Diana was the VP of CEW (Chief Executive Women), a member-based organisation representing Australia’s most senior women leaders from the corporate, public service, academic and not-for-profit sectors. From 2005 to 2008, Diana developed and led the CEW Leadership Program. Diana began her career as a high school teacher after studying Mathematics and Science at Sydney University.

general.headline: Networking, Collaboration & Leadership | Bestselling Author, Keynote Speaker, Mentor,Trainer: Melbourne, Sydney,Brisbane
general.description:
‘The right network is about having the right people and the right relationships in your professional and personal life.  Its about quality and never about quantity.’ - Janine Garner, “It’s Who You Know”, Wiley 2017.

Janine is one of Australia's leading experts on networking, leadership, influence and collaboration. She is a sought after speaker, trainer and mentor who helps Fortune 500s, CEOs, VPs, L&D Leaders and HR Leaders gain great commercial success, productivity and fulfilment. 

Janine has worked with leadership and high potential teams of some of the world’s best brands including Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Ernst & Young, Westpac, CISCO, Scentre Group, CBRE, Clayton Utz, Ralph Lauren, Jaeger and Citizen Watches. She is the author of ‘It’s Who You Know’ (Wiley) and is a regular contributor to The Australian, CEO Magazine, Success Magazine and Sky Business.

She has delivered keynotes for Fernwood Fitness, MyPlanner, ANZIIF PA Summit, Future of Leadership and Australian Human Resources Institute (AHRI).

Janine has an honorary doctorate in Science from Aston University (UK), is the winner of an International Stevie Award, was voted one of DARE Magazine’s Top 10 DARE Devil Women of 2013, one of Australia’s Most Inspiring Women (Madison Magazine), and nominated for Telstra Business Women Awards.

Janine is the Founder and CEO of the LBDGroup, a community of successful and results-oriented business women, thought leaders & entrepreneurs working collaboratively for continued change and success. Members are based in Brisbane, Sydney and Melbourne. 

She is also a Partner of Thought Leaders Global, the world leaders in education for Commercially Smart experts.

Janine is the founder of Australia’s first gift giving circle, First Seeds Fund, to reduce the impact of poverty and abuse at the grass roots of Australia, with a focus on education, community and employment support.

To contact Janine about speaking, workshops, LBD or media: support@janinegarner.com.au

jobs.jobTitle: Networking Expert | CEO | Networking & Leadership Author, Speaker, Trainer, Mentor
jobs.description:
‘Networking still matters - but it's your network that matters more’ – Janine Garner, author of the bestselling book “It’s Who You Know”, Wiley 2017.

Janine Garner is a networking, collaboration and leadership expert who is passionate about unleashing the brilliance in people to achieve extraordinary results through collaboration, connection and influential leadership.

FEMALE BUSINESS SPEAKER - Janine's incredible and inspirational career as an international brand management specialist and entrepreneur make her the perfect person to bring your conference and corporate events to life. Topics include: 

• FROM ME TO WE: Why Commercial Collaboration will Future-Proof Business, Leaders and Personal Success
• ACCELERATE YOUR LEADERSHIP: Get Real and and become a Leader worth following
• IT’S WHO YOU KNOW: How to Build a Small, Strategic and Successful Network of Quality Relationships to Support your Success
• ELEVATE: Take Your Female Leaders to the Next Level by Shifting Thinking to an Ownership Mindset that Gets Results

MENTOR TO CEOs IN BUSINESS - As a trusted advisor, and experienced and results-driven business woman, Janine is one of Australia's leading experts on networking, collaboration and leadership. She mentors business leaders across in Brisbane, Sydney and Melbourne, to gain great commercial success, productivity and fulfilment.

TRAINER - Janine’s customised leadership workshops for your management team and high potentials deliver inspiration, a way forward, and a cohesive approach to create extraordinary results.

‘Janine ran a comprehensive program for development of our top talent. Her approach and her personality led to this being an extremely successful program to the extent that we have re-engaged her. I strongly recommend talking to Janine if you want to do something different when it comes to developing staff.’ - VP, Communications, Media and Entertainment Industry, HPE

Contact Janine: support@janinegarner.com.au

jobs.jobTitle: Networking Expert | Founder & Director | Sydney | Melbourne | Brisbane
jobs.description:
LBDGroup is a community of business leaders and entrepreneurs, networking and contributing to drive mutual commercial and business success. Events are held in Brisbane, Sydney, Melbourne and London

Our members are business leaders, entrepreneurs and change makers who are committed to building success for their own and each others businesses through sharing connections, knowledge, learnings and insight.

Fearless, funny, fiercely forthright. Most newcomers say we’re generous of time, knowledge and spirit.

Members of the LBDGroup are cross functional and cross industry. Lawyers, bankers, marketing and PR professionals, media, mining, construction, designers, jewellery, fashion, philanthropists, non-for-profit, human resources, fitness, health and well-being, property, sales, speakers, executives and authors to name but a few. 

This is not a meet, greet and quickly swap cards and walk away business network. The LBDGroup is about community. It is about being able to sit down in a exclusive, unique and intimate environment and truly talk with other business people who may already inspire you – or making new connections whom you yourself can assist in some way with your own expertise and creative thinking. It is a think tank, a place for debate, inspiration, ideas and driving change. It’s a place for connection, business opportunity, partnership creation and business development.

LBDGroup is about networking, group mentoring, education, developing a success mindset, support in achieving your business goals and net-weaving for growth and success.

“Through Janine's sponsorship of me, I have grown dramatically as a person. I am better connected to women within and beyond the LBDGroup network, and so my business is growing faster and more strategically than I ever thought possible.” Dr Emily Verstege, Director of Multiplicite

To contact Janine about becoming a member of LBD email: support@thelbdgroup.com.au or visit http://www.thelbdgroup.com.au

The First Seeds Fund is committed to breaking the cycle of poverty and abuse at the grass roots of Australia. Our purpose is to improve the lives of women and children in Australia – with a focus on community support, education programs and employment opportunities.

Giving circles are a form of philanthropy where groups of individuals donate their own money or time to a pooled fund, decide together where to give these away to charity or community projects and, in doing so, seek to increase their awareness of and engagement in the issues covered by the charity or community project. Many circles, in addition to donating their money, also contribute their time and skills to support local causes.

Recent research found that that:
o	Giving circles influence members to give more.
o	Giving circles influence members to give more strategically.
o	Giving circles members give to a wide array of organizations.
o	Giving circle members are highly engaged in the community.
o	Giving circles increase members’ knowledge about philanthropy, nonprofits, and the community.
o	Giving circles have a mixed influence on members’ attitudes about philanthropy, nonprofit and government roles, and political/social abilities and values.  
Source http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Giving_circles

The board are committed to growing the First Seeds Fund across Australia including Brisbane, Sydney and Melbourne.

general.headline: Organisational Change Designer and Strategist
general.description:
Business Transformation | People Engagement | Organisational Change/ Change Communications | PR | Marketing | CRM | Events | Social Media | Writing | Channel Management | Internal Communications | Consultant

My major work profile over the last 15 years has been in large scale technological social change projects that impact the Australian community.  My first experience with change was on the rollout of digital television in Australia, which was launched in 2001 and I was lucky enough to work on the policy framework, the regulation development and then deliver public relations when Digital TV switched on in 2001.  After this amazing experience, I moved into the law field with an organisation that allowed me to develop my marketing nous over 5 years with pitching to clients and designing public sector engagement events. I helped design and implement a bespoke CRM system before these systems had any traction in the cloud!  

My next move was into accountancy and law, and I was fortunate enough to work on communications for IT change projects that impacted the Large Business Market.  I implemented the first GovDex workspace at ATO with my Large Business Stakeholders and I was responsible for stakeholder and client engagement with groups such as the Corporate Tax Association.  From there I moved across to the Department of Human Services and took on the role of Editor for News for Seniors - I reengineered the publication, saved the organisation significant money and increased the readability of the 32 page magazine to our 2.2 million pensioners.

I was approached to be the stakeholder engagement strategist to shift 40,000 employees into the SAP environment at DHS before moving onto australia.gov.au where I developed the communication strategy for transitioning 6.2 million customers into online services.  

In 2013, I left the public service to pursue Redgrass Communications.

general.headline: International leadership influencer | Keynote speaker | Executive mentor and coach | Body language | Vocal Intelligence.
general.description:
One of the most exciting female speakers on the global stage, Dr Louise Mahler captures the missing ingredient of leadership - your voice and body language - with enormous benefits for a leader's presence and influence.

Louise is an inspiration, in demand internationally for opening and closing keynotes, executive retreats, private coaching and her own intensive workshops. 

Dr Louise Mahler's work translates skills from the performance arts, the study of the mind-body relationship and business applications; providing practical inspiring improvement to global leaders. Louise's fun, interactive and highly practical methods have a transformational impact on the way our leaders in business and politics influence.

Louise's PhD, Vocal Intelligence, won outstanding recommendations and her University's business award for innovation. She is sought-after commentator on leadership body language and effective presentation on television, radio and in the media. She has a series of 36 videos on the Financial Review website and was chosen by IBM as a key creative source world-wide.

Louise works with Fortune 500 clients around the globe including BHP, IBM, Gartner and Transdev.

Louise's keynotes and workshops are simply brilliant and her high-stakes engagement retreats at health resorts worldwide are a unique leadership offering.

Her book 'Resonate' was published by Penguin Random House in 2015.

Specialties: voice, body-language, voice/body/mind connection, presence, influence, leadership, communication, difficult emotional situations, presentation, public speaking, media.

general.headline: Special Counsel at Andrew Croxford and Associates
general.description:
Leadership I Integrity Services I Advocacy I Change Management

In my previous role as Executive General Manager Integrity Services at Racing Victoria I was the head of integrity for the Victorian thoroughbred horse racing industry. As such, I had overall responsibility for the Chairman of Stewards, Head of Veterinary Services, Manager Equine Welfare, Head of Investigations and Intelligence, Manager Compliance Assurance Team and Manager Legal – General Counsel Legal.

During my tenure at Racing Victoria I was a member of the executive team involved in approving and implementing numerous commercial strategies including wagering, marketing and equine welfare initiatives.

I have enjoyed several  successful transitions throughout my career beginning in law enforcement, then as a senior steward, chief investigator which then was followed by qualifying as a barrister & solicitor, and now currently a practising solicitor - special counsel. During that period I held various senior management integrity roles with the Victorian racing industry, wagering and corporate sector. I have a strong academic background to compliment my professional ambitions and career.  These include an MBA, Bachelor of Laws, post graduate law qualifications and Specialised Graduate Certificate in Leadership (currently undertaking – Melbourne Business School). This combines with extensive professional development achievements such as admission to the Supreme Court of Victoria & High Court of Australia, Director - Racing Analytical Services Limited and Certified Fraud Examiner (CFE) Association of Certified Fraud Examiners USA.

My previous roles have provided me with significant opportunities to use my strong leadership, interpersonal, influencing and stakeholder management skills, such as advocating high profile cases for Racing Victoria, Harness Racing Victoria before the RAD Board, various tribunals and courts as well as in various capacities in the AFL and VFL.

jobs.location: Level 7, 533 Little Lonsdale Street, Melbourne, Victoria
jobs.description:
Special Counsel providing legal advice and advisory services to sporting, regulatory
      
      and corporate entities.

Executive General Manager Integrity Services at Racing Victoria with overall responsibility for the Chairman of Stewards, Head of Veterinary Services, Manager Equine Welfare, Head of Investigations and Intelligence, Manager Compliance Assurance Team and Manager Legal - General Counsel Legal.

The impact of the Victorian thoroughbred racing industry extends well beyond that seen on the racetrack. It is an integral part of the sporting life, cultural traditions and, importantly, the economy of Victoria. 

Racing is an industry that makes a significant contribution to the economy, while also constituting a key aspect of the state’s social fabric, both on a metropolitan and regional basis. 

In brief, it is:
•An exciting and strongly supported sport;
•A focus in many regional communities throughout the state;
•A major employer in Victoria; and
•A significant contributor to the state’s economy.

The report also revealed the Victorian thoroughbred racing industry:
•Generates nearly $2.1 billion in value for the Victorian economy
•Sustains the employment of more than 19,600 full time equivalent jobs for Victorians
•Provides $1.1 billion per annum in household income
•Generates $1.5 billion in spending – this incorporates both breeding and preparation of racehorses as well as on-and off-course customer expenditure. Nearly half of this spending occurs in regional parts of the state.
•Generates more than $483 million in total customer expenditure (incorporating both on-course and non-raceday expenditure).

Director of the Racing Analytical Services Ltd (RASL) Board until November 2012, driving the strategic direction of RASL to continue and enhance its reputation as one of the leading drug testing laboratories in the world.

RASL was  founded in 1988 to perform drug testing for the Victorian racing industry, RASL has been one of Australia’s leading drug testing laboratories for more than 25 years. RASL now provides a complete range of testing services to diverse clients including the AFP, Australian Customs and Border Protection Service and some of Australia’s most successful companies.

Each year RASL tests over 30,000 samples for the Victorian, South Australian, Tasmanian and Macau racing codes for over a thousand different drugs. The challenges of race testing ensures that the company employs the latest technology to provide fast, efficient and accurate testing every week of the year. This same technology and attention to detail is used in our workplace drug testing operations to guarantee the quality of our results. All tests performed by the company are backed by full NATA accreditation in compliance with ISO/IEC 17025.

One of the greatest challenges for any drug testing program is maintaining up to date screening methods as new drugs enter the market. RASL employs experienced research chemists specifically for this task. New drugs are often identified in samples intercepted by the Australian Customs And Border Protection Service and sent to the company for identification. These new drugs are then incorporated into our drug testing screens, providing the most up to date drug testing possible. 

RASL takes pride in the quality and sophistication of our drug testing techniques. With extensive experience in all aspects of drug analysis and reporting, we aim to provide the most complete and effective drug testing service in Australia.

website: http://www.rasl.com.au/rasl/

Previously, I was employed with Deloitte as Manager of the forensic practice, where I
      conducted high level investigations, reviews and implemented internal controls relating
      
      to fraud, risk, ethics and whistle blower policies for private and public sector clients.

Stipendiary Steward on Stewards' Panel and Senior Stipendiary Steward Industry Liaison (Chief Investigator) - Legal Advocate - prosecuted 'Blue Magic' cases before the Racing Appeals Tribunal. Then promoted to Manager Integrity Services.

Harness Racing Victoria was orignally established pursuant to section 39(1) of the Racing Act, 1958, it officially commenced operations as the Trotting Control Board on January 1, 1947. 

Harness Racing Victoria’s function is to administer, develop and promote the sport of Harness Racing in Victoria.

Our mission is “to develop a vibrant Harness Racing industry that promotes participation, integrity and racing excellence, grows wagering and other revenue streams and maximises returns to its stakeholders.”

Our goals and key objectives are to create a vibrant and sustainable harness racing industry by:
 
Maximising returns to participants and remain a market leader.
Improving the product and brand.
Increasing harness wagering turnover and market share.
Building a business that is stronger and more financially viable.
Increasing the professionalism of the sport.
HRV Values
Honesty

Be straightforward, honest and fair in your dealings with all people.
Accountability
Achieve results through the best use of your skills and experience.
Integrity
Ensure actions are not tainted by an actual or perceived conflict of interest.
Impartiality
Treat all people fairly impartially and honestly without fear or favour.
Responsive Service
Provide relevant, quality and timely communication and service to all.
Empathy
Maximize the wellbeing of participants.

ORGANISATIONAL STRUCTURE
Harness Racing Victoria is led by a seven member Board which report to the Minister for Racing.
It is managed by an Executive team comprising the Chief Executive and six General Managers each responsible for one of HRV’s units.
Attorney-General and Minister for Racing –The Hon. Martin Pakula

general.description:
At Sterning Human Resources you can rely on us to source Human Resources professionals on a temporary or permanent basis.

We are dedicated recruitment professionals with a diverse range of deep networks in the Human Resources community. We actively listen to clients and candidates to ensure we deliver tailored advice and the ideal results while maintaining the highest standards of service, integrity & quality control. 

We adopt traditional & modern sourcing strategies so that your business can access "hard to find" skill sets, whilst at the same time giving candidates access to rewarding positions and organisations beyond their own network and direct applications. Through networking activity, I can assist candidates in finding the ideal role that's in line with their interests, strengths, motivations and their greater career aspirations. Which in turn proves ongoing benefits to both themselves and their new organisations.

Our highest priority in business is maintaining long-term, successful, genuine partnerships in the Human Resources community. The highest compliment we can receive is a referral as a result of our work. 

When you connect with us you will receive updates on new HR roles; posts on thought leadership; discussions within the industry by subject matter experts and updates on the HR market.

general.headline: Chief Executive Officer at Umenco
general.description:
UMENCO believe in fuelling the fashion industry with kindness. 

Angela Briggs has lead the company - specialists in human resources, organizational and leadership development, recruitment, executive search and career coaching – on a path to openhearted, sustainable success.

As a single parent to a son with special needs and CEO of UMENCO, Angela was aware early on that her nurturing home life and demanding work role would collide.

Therefore, she has ensured they do so in a blaze of inspiration, purpose and prosperity that benefits both her clients and her son. 

At its core, UMENCO nurtures holistic fashion industry partnerships where internal culture and personal satisfaction are entwined, applauded and celebrated.

And it’s Thomas - Angela's son and muse - who has proven a pivotal motivator towards grounding each UMENCO relationship with kindness.

"Thomas is a reflection of the UMENCO values in his brave and beautiful approach to life,” explains Angela. “He continually inspires me to hold UMENCO up to the light to see what we can achieve with more love. In turn, our clients reap the rewards of that kind, nurturing approach in an otherwise competitive industry."

Clients then experience a happy and productive workplace and culture, proven to deliver high levels of performance, innovation, and commercial success.

"When we work together to build success that is sustainable, meaningful and contributes positively back to our community, we all achieve greatness," Angela says.

UMENCO's commitment to supporting children with autism is an integral thread the business.

In 2017, UMENCO partnered with client LIFewithBIRD to develop an in-house HR program in which 50% of the service fee is donated directly donated to Thomas's school, Giant Steps.

"Our team and clients are united and driven to create meaning and magic in each of our partnerships and projects," Angela explains. "I believe in any business, kindness and kinship is the most valuable form of currency."

general.headline: Volume Recruitment Coordinator at Transport for NSW
general.description:
With 10 years recruitment experience in both public and private sectors, Jeremy joins Transport for NSW from the private sector where he specialised in the recruitment of executive Government roles as well as managing complex, project-based recruitment functions within public sector agencies.

Jeremy currently provides a high touch specialist service to the Organisational Development area within People and Corporate Services, managing their annual Entry Level Talent Programs (ELTP) comprising dozens of vacancies and thousands of applications. 

Jeremy holds a Bachelor of International Business, and enjoys taking on new recruitment challenges that require an innovative approach and tailored solutions. Outside of work, worm farming and oil painting provide relaxation during the busy periods.

At Transport, our vision is for a truly integrated transport system that will meet the needs of our customers now and into the future. The Transport portfolio includes Transport for NSW as principal agency with Sydney Trains, NSW Trains, State Transit Authority and Roads and Maritime Services as our key operating agencies.

We are a values based organisation and employ the most talented people to work together to deliver services for our customers and make NSW a better place to live, do business and visit.

TfNSW are committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture across the Transport cluster, planning for and promoting diversity. We welcome and encourage applications from diverse community groups and ages including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander, LGBTI, people with disabilities, women and other diversity groups. TfNSW recognises the benefits that such an approach brings for our staff and customers in delivering the future of NSW.

general.headline: Strategic APAC Talent Acquisition Partner/Manager
general.description:
Over a decade of recruitment experience, gained as an on-site RPO / internal specialist and manager, external agency consultant, as well as in search & selection. Having commenced my recruitment career with a supply chain consultancy, I have since worked within the fashion sector, property and culminating in financial services / professional services in my current employment at Aon through Allegis Global Solutions.

This most recent role serviced a client base within a complex business across a variety of  hiring locations around Australia, and included people and vendor management, service review and presentation, management reporting and analysis, employment branding as well as driving behavioural and cultural change. 

In my years in recruitment I have also been a multiple-winner of awards and recognition, with repeated mention made by clients of his ability to understand and partner in the delivery of candidates with hard to find skills for niche roles, as swell as working on multiple projects, including business improvement and change management. 

Recently this has included Acting Recruitment / Account Manager, leading a team of 5 on-site at Aon, as well as Talent Acquisition Business Partner at Allegis Global Solutions head office.

Currently managing the recruitment process and team across Asia-Pacific at Ascender (10 countries).


Specialties: Talent Acquisition, Recruitment, Recruitment/Retention, Stakeholder Engagement & Management, Project & Change Management, Candidate Assessment, Headhunting, Supplier Selection, P&L and Budget Management, Integration, Vendor Management, Financial Services, Professional Services, Insurance, Software, Consultancy, Employee Referral Programs, ATS System Implementation, Social Media Networking Strategy, Mentoring, Team Leadership, Training, Strategic Sourcing.

jobs.description:
Ascender is the leading Human Capital Management (HCM) provider, including
      outsourced Payroll, HR services (including technology platforms, solutions, professional
      services as a BPO) and e-Learning in the Asia-Pacific region, with 1,000 employees and
      multiple offices serving 10 countries and 1,400 global brands and listed companies.
      Encompassing the former NGA HR, The Association of Payroll Specialists (TAPS), and
      
      PeopleStreme, we are a  fast-growing organisation via acquisition and organic growth.

Allegis Global Solutions is a leader in the design and delivery of innovative human capital solutions, supporting clients in more than 50 countries worldwide with 10,000+ employees. 

Within Allegis Global Solutions as an outsourced RPO organisation, my positions as Senior Talent Acquisition included onsite at Aon, American Express and internally at Allegis ANZ HQ.

Aon is the nation’s leading provider of broking and consulting services for risk management, insurance transactions, reinsurance, human capital consulting and financial planning with over 1,600 employees.

Aon Australia’s Talent Acquisition team is a key function within the HR group, and provides essential support for our broader People strategy. We consistently employ the broadest methods of strategic sourcing and best-in-class assessment to ensure that we are engaging with the best and brightest talent in the market.

As Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant for Aon Australia, my role was critical in delivering high-calibre appointments from entry to board level. During my time there, our team completely redesigned the talent acquisition solution.

This included innovation in assessment centre design and execution, implementation of cutting-edge selection and assessment technologies, re-design of Employee Referral Programme, EVP diagnostics and associated brand collateral design, and workforce planning methodology build and execution for this multi-national Blue Chip professional and financial services provider.

jobs.jobTitle: Talent Acquisition Manager on-site at Coles through Harrier Human Capital
jobs.description:
I manage the Talent Acquisition function at Coles for the Store Support Centre located in Melbourne, working through an RPO with Harrier Human Capital.

Leading a team of eleven Talent Acquisition Specialists, I work closely with stakeholders to deliver recruitment outcomes in line with the overriding organisational strategy. 

Today, Coles is one of Australia’s iconic retailers, providing a range of fresh food, groceries, general merchandise, liquor and fuel to millions of customers every week.

We have a combination of over 2,400 retail outlets across Australia covering Coles supermarkets, Coles Express fuel and convenience sites, Spirit Hotels and liquor stores under Liquorland, Vintage Cellars and First Choice Liquor branding.

While some things have changed over the years, one thing remains the same –our customer first strategy. We have over 107,000 fantastic team members across the country that are focused on making life easier for our customers and making a difference to the communities we serve every day.

Please visit our website http://www.colescareers.com.aufor all current vacancies.

general.headline: Operations, Transformation, Leader
general.description:
Having long been involved in creating sustainable organisations in business and HR leadership roles over a 20+ year period, Elizabeth has led, as well as coached CEO’s, Exec teams and facilitated multiple large-scale programs of business change, post-merger integration, disruption, expansion and contraction. 

Elizabeth executive experience includes commercial leadership of national multi-site businesses and diverse functional leadership teams, organisational transformation programs in both private and corporatised public sector, deep policy, governance, compliance, industrial relations, culture and change execution, combined with her customer, market, technology and product management expertise. 

An experienced member of Executive teams, Governance Committees and Boards, Elizabeth’s industry experience spans education, property, mining, electricity, financial services and facilities management sectors.

Elizabeth has also designed, refreshed and established policy frameworks, governance structures and internal audit processes with Boards, Committees and internal control functions.

She has demonstrated executive level change execution and benefits realization and is experienced at navigating large, complex and matrix organisations.
 
Her change experience includes significant cultural, efficiency, effectiveness and process re-engineering, training design, communications and engagement, risk mitigation, and multi-disciplinary execution and deployment across multiple geographies, and the use of formal change and project methodologies.
 
She holds embedded professional knowledge pertinent to all projects of the industrial, staff engagement and communication implications of project impacts through her extensive IR and HR career.

She holds a Bachelor of Commerce from UNSW and a Masters of Management from MGSM.

general.headline: Inspire, engage, educate, retain! Talent Sourcing Expert, talent strategist,  Unicorn finder, Game of Thrones nut!
general.description:
I'm a driver of change, and generally never happy with the status quo. I want to be doing better, ALWAYS! I believe recruitment can be better. I enjoy mentoring, training and leading others on their journey to success and recruitment enlightenment. 

So who is Mark Mansour? 
I'm creative, outgoing and flamboyant! I love engaging with people to understand what they are passionate about and to ensure that their next employer can provide the stimulation they require in the workplace! I'm also a lover of dogs (I own a Staffy and 2 Japanese Spitz - Instagram @snowyandprincess), technology, home renovation projects and make the best 10 layer, 4 cheese lasagna that will rock your world!   

What do I do you ask? I build talent management and sourcing strategies, in addition to providing high volume recruitment solutions. I develop Employee Value Propositions (EVP) and Candidate Value Propositions (CVP) and want to do what I can to provide a seamless interview experience to the candidates I engage with. I am the Liam Neeson of recruitment and sourcing. 

My experience covers, but is not limited to the following:-
* Sourcing Strategies via LinkedIn/Boolean Searches/Social Media (Facebook/Twitter/G+/Search Engines)
* Social Media Management #SoMe and Employer Branding
* Behavioural and technical Interviewing
* Developing position descriptions
* Market Mapping
* Retention strategies
* Competitor Analysis
* Talent Mapping/Pipeline Development

For a confidential discussion, please reach out to me via LinkedIn, Twitter or email.

I love sharing knowledge, mentoring other recruiters and generally trying to improve the perception of our sector. How did I do this? By analyzing data we already had, comparing them with trends in the business, and identifying skills that were repeatedly recruited, then creating and engaging with talent pipelines. This was done by a mix of Boolean searching of our database, X-ray searching LinkedIn, social media marketing and community management. You can never be too connected!

general.headline: Connecting Talent With Opportunities at Mirvac
general.description:
I love being a Dad, love flying my Drone, and I love finding great talent to come and work for a company as amazing as Mirvac.

I am often asked what makes Mirvac so great. Of course different people are looking for different things, but for me it is:

•	Flexibility – I am a Dad first. And I work at a company that allows me to truly balance my family and work commitments. 
•	Values – We put people first. We collaborate. We are passionate about quality and legacy. We are genuine and do the right thing. How we work matters. We are curious and bold.
•	Sustainability – Working for the World’s most sustainable property company is inspiring and sustainability is something I care deeply about.
•	Team – Our HR team is amazing, collaborative and we genuinely enjoy each other’s company.

This is what keeps me motivated and inspired each day. Others at Mirvac will have different ideas of why they love working here, and that’s the great thing. No matter what you want out of work, we can provide it to you at Mirvac.

jobs.description:
Mirvac is a leading, diversified Australian property group (ASX 50), with an integrated development and asset management capability. We have more than 40 years of experience in the property industry and an unmatched reputation for delivering superior products and services across our businesses.

Principally located in Australia's four key cities of Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane and Perth, Mirvac owns and manages assets across the office, retail and industrial sectors, with over $15 billion of assets currently under management. Our development activities allow us to create and deliver innovative and high-quality commercial assets and residential projects for our customers, while driving long-term value for our securityholders. 

Our integrated approach gives us a competitive advantage in the creation of quality assets across the entire lifecycle of a project; from planning through to design, construction and development, leasing, property management and long-term ownership. 

Recognising the contribution we make to Australia’s major cities, our purpose, Reimagine Urban Life, inspires us to question how and why we do things. With a strong focus on our customers, we’re asked to think about how we can redefine the landscape and create more sustainable, connected and vibrant urban environments, leaving a lasting legacy for generations to come.

As the Recruitment Manager for Mirvac I am responsible for leading the talent acquisition function on a National basis.

If you are interested in learning more about Mirvac and/or our career opportunities, please contact me on: 02 9080 8408 or email me at: justin.gill@mirvac.com

During this time I have worked for organisations such as Commonwealth Bank and
      
      NSW Government

We deliver these services internationally from our operating units in the UK & Europe, North America, the Middle East, Australia and New Zealand.

general.headline: Recruitment Manager Fashion -  Recruiting across Senior Exec Positions & the Design + Creative space.
general.school: London College of Fashion, University of the Arts London
general.description:
Hayley is the Recruitment Manager for Fashion at Scarlett Recruitment specialising in Design & Creative as well as recruiting across executive & senior level positions.

Recent projects Include:-

Chief Merchandise Officer - International Brand 
Head of Buying -  Youth Fashion retailer 
Creative Director - High End, Luxury Womenswear Label 
General Manager - Corporate wear
Director of Buying & Planning - Iconic Australian Retailer
Brand Manager - Queensland Based Activewear Brand
Head of Design -  Womens Fast fashion Retailer.

In addition I have placed numerous Senior Designers, Product Developers &Textile Artists within a variety of sectors including luxury, contemporary, DDS & homewares.

Hayley has a successful career spanning 17 years within the fashion industry.  During this time, Hayley has gained over 13 years of recruitment management expertise.
 
Having completed a BA (Hons) Degree in Fashion in London, this led to her first role within the industry, working in the Buying Office at Debenhams, a large retail group in the UK with over 158 Stores. This experience allowed Hayley to have a solid understanding of many of the functions within a fashion Head Office environment and the flow of product from manufacturing to the shop floor.  In turn, this has allowed Hayley to recruit using her expertise across the functions of buying, merchandising and technical and design roles.  Hayley has also gained knowledge of other functions including wholesale and e-commerce, giving her a very well-rounded knowledge of the fashion industry.

Hayley’s career then progressed into recruitment where she went on to manage the Wholesale, Technical and Design Team for one of the largest retail recruiters in London, Retail Human Resources plc.

After 4 years in this role she decided to emigrate to Sydney Australia and has spent the last 9 years working as a specialist fashion consultant with Scarlett Recruitment.

Our longevity is testament to our commitment to quality people development and placement retention where our candidates and clients continue to determine our past and future successes. Our clients and candidates are treated with equal respect throughout the recruitment process and after the placement. Our internal staff attend training on a weekly basis to ensure that they maintain industry expertise. We are retained by reputable fashion businesses to identify, source and evaluate individuals who stand out amongst their peers. These include individuals with a history of success in all areas of the fashion sector.  Scarlett Recruitment has the ability to recruit on a national basis with a selective database of talented candidates from within Australia as well as the UK, Europe, USA & Asia. Our success also extends to other senior head office support roles such as accounting, marketing, HR & e-Commerce where there is a preference to obtain a candidate already working in the fashion industry. Since partnering with Trak Recruiting in 2009, Scarlett Recruitment is now able to offer clients additional value in sourcing high calibre candidates for roles within the retail sector, through to the level of CEO. Scarlett Recruitment strives to deliver an incomparable, professional service which includes a genuine enthusiasm for the personal development of our candidates as well as the introduction of candidates that will add value to our clients’ businesses. general.headline: Talent Acquisition Manager @ ANZ
general.description:
ANZ is a leading regional bank with representation in 34 markets, focusing on core markets in Australia, New Zealand and Asia Pacific. As we continue our journey to build our global business and support our customers, we’re committed to attracting and retaining the best talent. We’ve made it our business to be an organisation where people strive, and are rewarded, for excellence.

We aim to create a work environment where employee differences such as gender, age, culture, disability, sexual orientation, family and caring responsibilities and religion are valued.
In order to achieve our goals, we know we need to nurture great people. That’s why we’ve made it our business to be an organisation where people want to work and can deliver their best.

We expect you to take ownership of your career and ambitions while we provide learning and development opportunities to help you achieve your goals, as well as competitive remuneration and benefits. In line with our focus on outperformance, employees who deliver great results and outperform while doing the right thing can expect to receive higher rewards.

We want the best talent working at ANZ – no matter who they are or where they’re from. Diversity of ideas and experiences is key to our success.

ANZ is a culturally diverse organisation with employees born in more than 130 countries who speak over 90 languages, and we promote flexibility as the way we work. Our work/life flexibility options include: flexible hours, job sharing, roaming work, part-time work, career extension for over 55s, career breaks and carer’s, lifestyle and study leave.

jobs.description:
Leadership role within ANZ's Recruitment & Resourcing function, I am responsible for service alignment and co-ordination of all recruitment activity within the Institutional Banking and Global Enablement Functions (Risk, Finance & HR) across the Australia Geography.

I lead a team of highly experienced and specialised recruiters to deliver recruitment services to internal client groups, as well as play a significant role in the knowledge transfer of policy, process and market intelligence to offshore support teams to ensure an effective operating model. 

Lead team to deliver optimal ROI through stand out quality of consulting and managing cost/quality per hire whilst striving to exceed service and performance targets. We work closely with our offshore teams to deliver a seamless process to our stakeholders.

In this position I also take a lead role in ensuring risk management considerations feature in all policy & governance decision processes.

In addition to the responsibilities of my day to day role, I am also a Social Media Ambassador, Max Connect Champion and member of ANZ's Pride Network.

general.headline: Assessment Manager at ANZ
general.description:
Josh is a HR/OD professional and registered psychologist who has six years of experience across assessment for selection/development, strategic HR consulting and large scale project management. 

Josh has designed and delivered assessment, leadership and talent management solutions, across both private and public sector clients. He is a motivated, enthusiastic and ambitious individual who is comfortable in fast-paced environments where focus, resourcefulness, and adaptability are essential. He prides himself on being a team player who is genuine, respectful and supportive of the needs of others.

Some major projects Josh has worked on have included:

• Design, development and delivery of state wide prison officer recruitment for the Department of Justice and Regulation, including the development of an end to end recruitment approach
• Partnered with key ANZ senior stakeholders to facilitate, design and roll out the New Ways of Working (NWOW) digital interviews assessment process
• Design and delivery of executive level assessment and development centres across various clients, including 360 feedback surveys and leadership profiling
• Delivery of graduate and indigenous volume recruitment for various public sector clients
• Design and facilitation of interview skills training for director-level employees for various financial services clients

Josh is a registered psychologist accredited by the Australian Health Practitioner Regulation Agency (AHPRA) in partnership with the Psychology Board of Australia (PysBA). He has been accredited in a number of psychometric tests including: the Hudson Assessment for Selection/Development tools, TalentQ, OPQ Personality Assessments,  the Hogan Accreditation Systems, the Emotional Intelligence Inventory, and the MLQ Suite of Leadership Assessment Tools.

Specialities: Volume Recruitment & Selection, Leadership Development, Talent Management and Psychometric Assessment/Testing.
