general.headline: Transport for NSW
general.description:
I lead a branch of ~75 professionals within the Freight, Strategy & Planning Division to shape the future transport mobility agenda and how it fits within TfNSW’s Future Transport 2056  Strategy. The teams I lead cover:
·         Transport data & analytics: undertaking innovative data science projects to gain better insights into the transport system through the application of analytics to Opal data and external data sources, as well as consolidating transport data collection including the Household Travel Survey and other agency data sources to improve model development and forecasting
·         Future technology: including the Smart Innovation Centre which is building collaborative partnerships to test transport technology on our network, such as NSW’s first automated shuttle trial which will inform our infrastructure and planning needs of the future and support integration of these technologies into our transport network
·         Future strategy: Shaping NSW’s engagement with emerging transport technologies and innovative mobility as a service models to better manage congestion, support the roll-out of electric, connected and automated vehicles, the shared economy and continuation of mass transit for the efficient movement of people and goods. To promote the benefits that smart city technologies can have in urban renewal and transport design.  
·         Research: setting the Strategic Research Directions for TfNSW that focus on the important and complex problems facing transport over the next 40 years, undertaking and managing innovative and practical research projects that better inform future directions and building collaborative academic research partnerships

general.headline: Digital Talent Innovation Lead @ Deloitte Australia
general.description:
My role is to take business and client problems related to people, HR, recruitment and growth and identify creative and innovative ways to solve them. Using a combination of human-centred design, data analytics and some methodologies borrowed from the world of lean start up, a typical approach would bring together cross functional teams to devise quick and cheap ways to validate potential solutions. I hate failing but I'd rather fail fast and learn and adapt along the way.

Often this is through the introduction of new technology in a way that reduces costs, enhances operational efficiencies and allows us to grow and compete more effectively.

I've successfully managed and implemented a number of experiments and MVPs, system/technology implementations, change processes and projects from the design and business case stage, right through to training of staff teams and post-project evaluation and monitoring. I'm a Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) and qualified in Human Centred Design.

I'm passionate about innovation, HR technology, solving problems, company strategy and how this relates to satisfaction, engagement and productivity.

jobs.description:
Business Concepts is are part of the team that is driving Randstad's digital transformation alongside our colleagues in IT, digital marketing, HR and operations (Google Randstad Human Forward/Tech and Touch for more information) 

My favourite initiatives in the last 12 months have been:

- Building and launching (as part of a small cross functional team) an algorithm that predicts with up to 90% accuracy, which clients are likely to stop using us 
- A subsequent initiative to drive user adoption of the predictive analytics dashboard, after our pilot resulted in a 9% reduction in client churn
- Launch of Pymetrics, a tool that uses AI, neuroscience and gamification to match potential applicants with our top performing staff. 
- Building the business case for robotic process automation within Randstad Australia - haven't cracked this yet but I aim to!
- An MVP involving chatbots VS existing HR tech called "Do we need a bot or not"
- Using my Human Centred Designed skills to device an internal innovation competition within Randstad ANZ
- Helping to secure a place for Randstad on an experiential learning program with a well known Australian University - watch this space
- An experiment to increase female applicants to jobs by A/B testing the impact of the use of language and video in job ads

I like to keep abreast of local and global HR technology with my colleagues at the Randstad Innovation Fund and often run small scale experiments and pilots, many of which have progressed into larger roll-outs. It's my job along with my team to manage the end to end process and metrics to work out which tools and techniques actually solve the problems they were intended to and guide our staff through the change process.

Corporate innovation is by far the toughest but most rewarding area I've worked within, to date.

Get in touch today if you would like to know more: reatts@hrpartners.com.au 0261323802

Follow the HR Network Group Facebook and join the LinkedIn group!
Visit www.hrnetworkgroup.com.au and select your city to view the schedule and speakers for 2017!

Strategic Recruitment | Human Resources | Procurement | Executive

Tell me about your people engagement and talent attraction challenges....

With the massive influence of technology and social media what does the future of recruitment and people engagement look like to you. How is machine learning, robotics and artificial intelligence impacting your sector, work place, employment and culture?

Do you see your current and future work force evolving to a contingent or permanent... or perhaps freelance work force. Do you have a strategy in place to ensure the stand out talent in your market is attracted to your brand and how will you find them and keep them.. do you even need to keep them?

Or maybe you just don't have the time and resources to find the right people for your business..... 

Tell me about your job hunting challenges....

The work force is changing.. temporary contracts, permanent, non-ongoing, part time job share, casual, freelance. What are the pros and cons and what is important for you?

jobs.description:
This role is responsible for either permanent or temporary/contract placements in a specific (sub) sector; covering a limited number of mid to high job profiles and focusing on a limited number of clients.

priorities for the role
To achieve personal sales targets through:
• Developing and managing a defined client and candidate base

• Delivering high quality recruitment consultancy and services

The main accountability areas for this position are:

• Acquisition and client management

• Recruitment and candidate management

• Administration and reporting.

• Formulate a client and candidate development plan, together with the manager, to support the achievement of personal sales targets.

• Initiate a range of sales and marketing activities, in accordance with the client and candidate development plan, to attract business.

• Develop and maintain trusted relationships with clients to ensure a good understanding of their current and future priorities and to identify new leads within the Randstad Group.

• Keep abreast of and analyse market and sector developments to support the provision of high quality advice to clients.

• Prior to commencing client assignment, negotiate and agree on terms and conditions with the client, in accordance with company policies, to mitigate commercial issues or complaints.

• Growth in market share of existing and prospect clients.

recruitment and candidate management

• Initiate a range of sourcing activities, such as publishing vacancies, networking and conducting referrals, to ensure a regular supply of candidates that meet client’s current and future demands.

• Develop and manage the recruitment process for clients through sourcing, screening and qualifying candidates, briefing and preparing candidates, organising interviews and sometimes negotiating remuneration packages to ensure client needs and expectations are met in a timely manner.

Specialising in Industrial recruitment my role was to predominately;

* Develop a database of suitably qualified and experienced candidates using pro-active, cost-effective sourcing and screening techniques to optimise the interview-to-hire ratio 

* Evaluate, assess, conduct reference checks and select candidates for prospective employment in line with Kelly systems, policies, procedures and legislative requirements 

* Provide candidates with appropriate information to make informed decisions 

* Match appropriately qualified and experienced candidates to client order specifications 

* Maintain a contact cycle with newly placed candidates and clients to foster retention 

* Comply with Kelly systems, policies, procedures and all legislative requirements 

* Provide accurate, timely information and advice to clients to most effectively meet their needs 

* Manage any issues that arise from recruitment activities in line with policy and procedures 

* Maintain documentation and records that meet Kelly systems, policy, procedural and legislation requirements, including adherence to privacy requirements for record accuracy and currency 

* Conduct all communication and activity in a professional and ethical manner 

* Comply with, and actively support Kelly workplace health and safety policies and processes. 

* Prevent issues arising by adhering to all requirements including, but not limited to, Kelly systems, policy and procedures, code of conduct, industrial instruments and legislation. 

* Minimise risk through prompt follow up and resolution of queries and concerns in line with policy and procedures. 

* Promptly escalate issues for attention where required.

To assess the needs of disadvantaged job seekers with disability, injury or health condition and provide a broad range of service assistance measures in order to gain and maintain sustainable employment opportunities.

* Managing the referral/intake process of jobseekers into the program through the DEEWR IT system and JN Solutions Bridge. 

* Build strong relationships with referrers and associated key stake holders.

* Establish a rapport with job seekers in order to identify vocational and pre-vocational needs.

* Develop and maintain tailored employment pathway plans in conjunction with jobseekers which identifies specific employment outcomes, work preparation strategies, job seeking strategies, tailored interventions (including other service providers) and employment support activities.

* Provide pre-employment assistance through vocational counselling, training, job search skills, and work trials/work experience to increase capacity for employment

* Achieve job placements and sustainable employment outcomes.

* Continually survey the local job market in order to locate suitable employment opportunities.

* Support clients in the workplace to maintain ongoing employment through effective PPS.

* Maintain regular face to face contact with clients in line with individual objectives.

* Development of effective relationships with jobseekers with disability, injury and health conditions and with key stakeholders,

* Assessment of jobseeker skills, abilities, identification of barriers and intervention strategies.

general.fullName: Dr Deborah Harcourt PhD MEd BEd DipT
general.headline: Executive Director at Asia Pacific Early Childhood Consultants
general.description:
I have been working in early childhood for 25 years both in Australia and abroad. I am currently working across the higher education and consulting sectors in raising the quality of experiences for young children attending early learning programs with a particular focus on the principles of Reggio Emilia. 

I co-founded the Children's Participation in Research SIG with Dr Alison Clarke in 2004 for the European Early Childhood Research Association. I am also currently the Deputy Editor of the Australasian Journal of Early Childhood. My scholarly work focuses on children's right to be active participants in decision-making with publications that explore participation, informed consent and ethics of researching with children. I am particularly interested in an international exploration of young children's views and opinions on number of issues such as quality, rights and the social construction of childhood. 

In my consultancy work, I am focusing on developing professional inquiry as the driver for curriculum decisions.

general.headline: Recruitment Projects Specialist at Goodstart Early Learning
general.description:
I love my job as I get to work with great like minded people and think outside the box to find the right candidate for each role I recruit for, "right person, right role"​.

Since 2012, I have been a part of our evolving team in the Goodstart Early Learning family and have really enjoyed this as it has helped my to grow personally and professionally. Along the way I have develop some really wonderful working relationships, also lifelong friends. 

One of the reasons I love my role at Goodstart is their vision and guiding principles align closely with mine.
Goodstart is Australia’s largest early learning provider.  As a not–for–profit social enterprise, we exist purely to improve the lives of Australia’s children and their families.  Every day, 13,500 Goodstart staff support over 60,000 families and the 71,500 children that attend our 648 centres nation–wide.  Our people are our foundation, together we are working to ensure children have the learning, development and wellbeing outcomes they need for school and life. 

Goodstart is driven by three guiding principles: 

1. Children are central to everything we do

2. Families are our primary partner

3. Being a valued part of each unique community

Our vision is for Australia’s children to have the best possible start in life. We’ll achieve this by fulfilling our mission, which is to provide high-quality, accessible, affordable, community-connected early learning in our centres, as well as partner and openly collaborate with the sector to drive change for the benefit of all children.

So if you want to come join the Goodstart Family please visit http://careers.goodstart.org.au/ or message me.

• Raise purchase orders as required for processing of invoices.
• Providing administrative support as required including handling phone enquiries, filing, archiving and mail duties.

• Recording and collating minutes of State Workplace Health and Safety Committee

• Liaise with key staff to coordinate and maintain staff Work Cover files for 10 facilities throughout QLD.
• Preparation of weekly and monthly reports as required by the State and General Managers for strategic decision making purposes at both state and national level.
• Other administrative duties as required.

general.headline: Recruitment Industry Specialist
general.school: The University of Notre Dame Australia
general.description:
Tracy joined the recruitment industry in 1994 working for a well recognised international recruitment generalist.  From there, Tracy was recruited into a boutique recruitment firm to assist in the growth and development of a newly created business.  After 5 successful years, Tracy was then appointed to General Manager running a business with a turnover in excess of $14mil pa and approximately 25 staff.  In 2002, Tracy formed a partnership with two others to commence, grow and develop a successful banking & finance and insurance business which was then sold to a publicly listed firm in 2006. 

Tracy (& her former business partner)  commenced Early Learning Placements in 2010.  Early Learning Placements is a successful boutique recruitment specialist whose sole focus is on recruiting professionals within the Early Childhood & OOSH industries on both a casual and permanent basis.  

Early Learning Placement's is Sydney's leading boutique specialist for the early childhood sector working with local government, not for profit, community and private centres with a focus on raising the industry standard.

Tracy has recently completed her Masters of Business (major Human Resources - graduates April 2018) and is a voluntary council member of the Recruitment & Consulting Services Association (RCSA).

jobs.description:
Early Learning Placements is a boutique recruitment specialist whose sole focus is on recruiting professionals for the Early Childhood Industry together with OOSH Services on both a casual and permanent basis.

Early Learning Placements is raising the service standard being delivered to the early childhood industry. With 24 years recruitment industry experience and thus understanding that the recruitment of quality staff plays a crucial role in the success of any business, Tracy commenced Early Learning Placements with her former business partner in 2010. Due to our teams extensive recruitment methodology, Early Learning Placements is able to work in partnership with clients to truly understand what they are wanting and then to screen and assess candidates via a consistent and thorough application process.

Our mission is to focus on both the key recruitment requirements of our client businesses whilst assisting our candidates to find the best matched position to meet their career expectations.

Recruitment of great staff is a unique skill and Early Learning Placements are proud of the quality service we consistently deliver.  Early Learning Placements has access to an extensive talent pool.

Tracy has recently completed her Masters of Business (Major HR) and represents the RCSA as a NSW council member promoting ethical recruitment practices.

Tracy Initially  was a Co-Director with Julia Bradbury & Stuart Freeman where they developed SMF Recruitment a boutique Banking, Finance & Insurance recruitment firm.  Upon sale of the business to the Rubicor Group, Tracy  then worked as General Manager for the next 3 years where her role was focused on business operations & processess, staff hiring, training & management along with business improvement strategies across numerous locations.

Tracy initially joined Freeman Adams in the start up phase of the business as Team Manager – Temporary Desk.  Once the business was sold to Candle IT & T who is listed on the Australian Stock Exchange & the owners of Freeman Adams left, Tracy was promoted to General Manager where she was successfully managed the business and up to 35 staff.

general.headline: CEO at Guardian Early Learning Group

jobs.description:
Guardian Early Learning Group is a private equity backed early learning group that owns high quality early learning and childcare centres in Australia. In early 2015, we owned 55 centres across Australia, but now we have over 92 centres across Australia.

I started the business with four friends in 2004 as a management company, and by 2009 we were managing more than 40 centres, including a portfolio of 17 that we had acquired for an institutional client. In 2010, I left Abacus Property Group and with the help of our first private equity firm, Wolseley Private Equity, acquired the institutional portfolio and established Guardian as both an owner and manager of early learning centres. We then acquired 10 centres in 2011 and in 2012 we acquired ten company-sponsored centres through our acquisition of Sarah Mackenzie'sJigsaw Corporate Childcare.

In 2013 Wolseley sold its majority interest in the business to Navis Capital and since that time, we have acquired another 12 centres, opened several and built a head office team to oversee the group's day to day operations and future growth plans.  In 2016 we joined forces with Partners Group to enable our business to grow, develop and reach its full potential.

Our business strategy is fairly simple:
- manage our existing centres at world's best performance levels;
- grow our portfolio through selective acquisition of premium assets and the opening of premium centres in premium locations
- enhance our operational systems
- build a great culture and workplace

We welcome anyone interested in working with us on our exciting journey to contact our recruitment team to explore potential opportunities.

During my time with Abacus, an ASX 200 AREIT, I oversaw the management and expansion of the group's funds management business. This business managed a range of assets across the commercial property, self-storage, mobile homes park and childcare sectors, owned by the clients of some of Australis's pre-eminent wealth management businesses. I also helped managed investor relations and capital markets strategy, leading the raising of more than $300m of equity.

While at Patersons Securities (previously Paterson Ord Minnett), I specialised in raising
      capital for small cap, listed property trusts and other income stocks. This comprised a
      mix of initial public offerings, placements, rights issues, underwriting of dividend
      
      reinvestment plans etc.

During this period with BBY I transitioned from lawyer/management consultant to investment banker, learning about the markets, trading, investment banking, persuasion skills etc. I enjoyed raising capital for a range of companies including a South Australia uranium mine, working on the IPO of Abacus Property Group and completing an on-market takeover of a recruitment company.

3PP was a high growth start-up that was into its third year of operations when I joined as General Manager. Its business provided third party logistics support to leading Australia fashion retailers through advanced pick and pack technology. While the business had a pre-eminent client list, it mis-priced the delivery of its services and quickly hit financial difficulties, which ultimately lead to it being wound up. I spent most of my time overseeing its operations, assessing its true financial position, working on solutions to improve profitability and potential sale options, but ultimately they failed and I then worked with the administrators to close five sights and lay-off more than 300 staff.

After graduating form law school, I joined Corrs' industrial relations practice, where I worked with Ian Macphee and John Denton developing workplace reform and enterprise bargaining strategies for clients across a range of sectors, including retail, health care, tourism, warehousing etc. Our approach was focused on mutual gains bargaining with management and union representatives and proved highly successful. 

In 1996 I was awarded a Fulbright Scholarship to spend 4 months in the USA studying high performance work organisations in unionised settings. I spent three months visiting a range of leading companies including Saturn Motor Company, Nabisco, various steel companies, Levi Strauss etc, and then concluded with a month at MIT in Massachusetts. I combined this with an 8 month secondment with Tom Schneider's Restructuring Associates Inc, a Washington DC based consulting firm that specialised in socio-technical redesign in unionised settings. I facilitated a number of joint union-management design teams through a number of redesign processes, spending most of my time at a couple of Unilever manufacturing plants.

Upon my return to Australia in 1997, I worked with Chris Ralph in establishing Corrs Schneider, a joint venture consulting business that sought to bring the methodologies of Restructuring Associates to Australia. I worked on a range of client projects aimed at creating high engagement, high performance work systems. In 1999 I made partner with Corrs, but after a year or so, I realised that I  wanted to pursue more entrepreneurial endeavours in the future, and decided to leave to commence this exciting new journey.

general.headline: HR Specialist Helping Small to Medium Businesses  Realise Their Potential Through the Sourcing of Exceptional Talent
general.description:
Are you a SME Owner, Director or Manager responsible for creating a winning culture amongst your talent . Are you proud of your talent retention or worried about your staff attrition rate.

Most SME Businesses are challenged with staff turnover as a direct result of their staff member’s lack of engagement. This stems from indifference with your company’s purpose and mission which in turn manifests more often than not in to cultural misalignment.

Imagine a time and cost efficient resource that helps you build a winning culture amongst your staff through the placement of exceptional talent aligned to your businesses core values, Who through complete engagement work collaboratively together promoting your business through their efforts as a market leader.

I am the Talent Acquisition specialist at WhiteCollarBlue and I have spent over 25 years across both the NZ and Australian markets sourcing and securing exceptional talent for my clients across the SME market. The talent I place are a strong cultural match and therefore drive positive results through being fully engaged delivering increased productivity and profitability for my customers businesses.

I love to help my customers build a winning culture through sourcing exceptional talent. It is a passion of mine to help SME owners build their company one talent member at a time.
  
To learn more about how I may be able to assist you in building a winning culture in your business. Contact me at grantstyles@whitecollarblue.com.au

general.headline: HR Services Manager at Volvo Group Australia
general.description:
I started my HR Career at The Henley Group which was a young, innovative company that owned and was responsible for the management of multiple companies and franchises. 

I started from the grass roots of the organisation working my way up through front line management, sales & marketing as well as operations before stepping into the HR industry and tackling the development and execution of the initial and current HR structure for the company. Over a 9 month period I single-handedly developed and implemented the HR strategy that initiated the first HRIS, HR Policies and Procedures, Assessment and updated JD's and KPI's for over 80 staff. It was the incorporation of a well managed HR function that facilitate strong growth and development for the people organisation of the company, keeping in line with the business plan and organisational objectives.

My extensive business experience has strengthened my HR capabilities and has seen me work along side some innovative leaders in the digital space. I have strength in change management practices and have achieved positive transitions for multiple projects across varying industries. 

I consider myself to be an Executive Level HR Professional with an entrepreneurial spirit. I excel in a fast paced environment that requires HR in the trenches working for the people. I am a natural born leader who believes in having an in-depth understand of 'the self' before anything else and I actively up-skill to keep myself at the forefront of the industry. 

I am obsessive about achieving best practice outcomes that are mutually beneficial for employee and employer. I pride myself on my fearless approach to effective communication in the workplace and have first hand experience doing the hard yards to resolve issues and deal with conflict efficiently and effectively. 

I am drawn to innovative organisations and desire to work directly with people to achieve strategic impact on the future of the company.

From 1993 until 2006 I was the Operations Manager within with in my own company Wilson Showcase. In this key position I was responsible for the employment, training and development of all new and existing employees .As part of my role as operations manager I was also responsible for sales budgets, product development, accounts and payroll.

I am a proud advocate for early childhood and believe in building deeply respectful relationships with all that are around me both adults and children alike.  
I believe that having a child centred approach helps educators to focus on quality outcomes for children and I believe in advocating for children’s abilities to make their own choices and being active members of their local communities.

I hold an Bachelor of Teaching (Early Childhood) as well as Master of Education (Leadership) and I enjoy working with colleagues in an collaborative way and strongly believe that teams are only successful through a shared understanding of vision, purpose and collaborative discussions.

general.headline: Early Childhood Teacher (Nursery & Toddler) at Mornington Street Early Learning & Kinder. Bachelor of Education (Early Childhood & Primary)
general.description:
Hi, my name is Greta Mauerhofer.

I am a passionate, fun, caring and patience individual lives to put children first and to ensure the safety and wellbeing of others. I have a strong understanding of the National Quality Framework and Early Years Learning Framework.

I have relocated from Melbourne to Canberra in February 2016 to work for Goodstart Early Learning, and I am currently studying at The University of Canberra, continuing my Primary Education degree. This will be completed in January 2019.

I have a very outgoing & bubbly personality. I feel very confident in social situations so being able to communicate with other educators and parents allows me to accomplish and achieve effective curriculum programs.

Being an Early Childhood Educator throughout my professional working experience working for 8 years in a full-time role as a Room Leader, I feel I have been truly blessed by the amount of learning the children.

I am a highly motivated, knowledgeable and professionally self-driven individual that has a strong passion to work with younger children. I am Currently studying at RMIT University as I continue on my Teaching Journey and further my knowledge in completing my Bachelor of Education (Primary). I have completed a Diploma of Early Childhood Education at Box Hill Institute of TAFE in November 2011. 

I possess sufficient time management skills and transferrable skills that allow me to work effectively under pressure in multitask situations, as on a daily work basis I'm dealt with multiple opportunities where children require my assistance with self help skills or intentional teaching learning experiences and I have gained the ability to do multitask because of these situations.

For 6 years, I have been employed as a ‘Room Leader’ in both the Nursery room and Toddler’s age group and have worked in cooperation with a Kindergarten teacher as an assistant for a year at a privately owned day care centre.

Enabling opportunities to gain the necessary skills to become a dynamic teacher and to inspire the next generation.I will have the opportunity to undertake innovative professional experience placements within a variety of educational settings, so I can spend more time in classrooms to get a head start in your career.

Through the support of experienced trainers and extensive Industry work-placement you will gain comprehensive knowledge of regulatory authorities, providing children with a safe and healthy environment, working in partnerships with families, supporting children with additional needs and building effective teams.

jobs.description:
Educating Kids is an Australian owned business dedicated to education for the Early Years. We believe in making beautiful resources available to all children.

We offer quality resources that create a natural and relaxed foundation in which educators and children can add their own passions and personality.

We promote natural resources like timber. Through the warm feel of timber, a sense of wonder about natural resources is created. Natural resources also better reflect the child's home environment. 

We offer resources that promote open ended play. Children learn through exploration and imagination and our resources create endless opportunities and positive learning experiences for the children. 

We respect our environment working with like-minded suppliers and manufacturers to offer a range of natural and recycled products. Supporting a number of local and indigenous communities by supplying handmade resources.

We work closely with Early Childhood professionals to develop unique resources for the Early Years and offer an affordable product range including: 

Furniture 
Toys and educational resources 
Outdoor equipment

什麼是「物業折舊」？
優點就像利用折舊汽車或電腦的方法去減輕稅務。您也可以利用投資物業折舊去幫助減低您的稅務支出。
物業折舊可分為兩部份：
1. 設備及裝置——例如焗爐、洗衣機、地毯、窗簾等
2. 樓宇結構及相關工程——例如混凝土、磚牆等

「物業折舊報告」怎樣可以幫到您？
很簡單，折舊報告可以幫您減低應繳的稅款，我們可讓您知道物業折舊的價值，以用作抵消您的稅務支出。物業折舊又稱非現金可減少的稅款，它是唯一的折舊不用額外付錢。因為物業折舊沒有真正的現金交易，所以可減少的稅款已包含在賣買樓宇的價格內。

物業折舊報告不是會計師做的嗎？
當然不是，會計師只可以幫助你處理一般稅務，但專業的物業折舊報告一定要由「澳洲稅務從業委員會註冊的代理及建築物料測量師」準備的才合符稅務局的認同。

準備一份折舊報告收費昂貴嗎？
折舊報告的收費視乎物業的位置、大小和其他因素而定，您現在所支付的費用與將來減少的稅款比較，實在是物超所值，明智選擇，而且收據可作為扣稅之用。

爲何選擇大生折舊？
•收據可作爲100％扣稅之用
•報吿合符澳洲稅務局規格要求
•大生折舊是合規格的物料測量師公司及稅務從業委員會註冊的代理

I hold a MBA degree from the Australian Graduate School of Management, a BScEng (Civil) Degree & am a Member of the Australian Institute of Company Directors (AICD).

澳大利亚SIV投资方案 (SIV Solutions Australia)
澳大利亚重大投资者签证 (Australian Significant Investor Visa)

为了吸引有兴趣通过投资移民到澳大利亚的高净值人士，从而进一步推动澳洲的经济发展，澳大利亚政府于2012年11月推出了一个新的签证类别，即“重大投资者签证” (Significant Investor Visa)，简称为”SIV”。

重大投资者签证概述（Significant Investor Visa – Overview)
澳大利亚政府对于这一签证的条件是：移民投资者需投资500万澳币在澳大利亚的特定投资项目上，为期至少四年时间，即有资格申请永居签证。

重大投资者签证的基本条件 (Significant Investor Visa basics)
· 投资至少500万澳币在澳大利亚的核准投资项目上，并为期至少四年时间，即有资格申请永居签证
· 没有英语水平要求，毋需满足创新类分数评估或年龄上限要求
· 在投资的四年内，必须在澳大利亚境内逗留至少160天。

重大投资者签证 － 服务 (Significant Investor Visa – Services)
我们不仅与各合规基金的金融服务机构合作，还与移民代理机构携手，这样我们能为重大投资者签证的申请人提供“一条龙”式的服务。

我们为资金雄厚、投资资深因而需要有隐私保护的理财服务的客户，尤其为对澳大利亚永居权有兴趣的移民提供整合金融服务。我们的工作地点主要是在悉尼，但也可在东南亚各地。

澳大利亚重大投资者签证 (Australian Significant Investor Visa)
这一新的签证于2012年11月推出，它能使富豪移民快速得到澳大利亚永居权。作为交换，他们要在合规的投资项目上投资500万澳元，为期4年。想居留澳大利亚的申请人毋需满足创新类分数评估或年龄上限要求。签证的一项条件是在四年时间内要在澳大利亚境内逗留160天，投资者和其家属在工作、旅行、学习上不受任何限制。这为居留澳大利亚提供了一个极具吸引力的途径。

最新消息 (News)
力求在合规投资项目上投资的人士可在等待签证期间先申请现金基金。如果以后他们希望转到更符合他们承受风险能力和投资目标的项目上，就可以从包括各种投资组合的一整套的重大投资者基金中进行选择。

我们经常在亚洲各国寻找能把有举家移民澳大利亚意向的富豪介绍给我们的人士。

jobs.description:
We provide Investor Visa solutions to assist wealthy clients for migration to & investment in Australia, particularly under the 132 & 188 Significant Investor Visa 重大投资者签证 (SIV). We offer a "one-stop" shop for applicants by working with immigration specialists, as well as the providers of various complying funds & concierge services. Thus, we provide high level 'connectivity' between wealthy clients & the Australian Investor Visa industry.

In particular, the Business Innovation & Investment (Provisional) visa (subclass 188C), launched in Nov 2012, allows wealthy migrants to fast-track residency in exchange for investing A$5m in complying investments for a four-year period. Applicants looking to reside in Australia no longer need to satisfy the innovation points test or upper age limits. This visa features a residence requirement of only 160 days spent in Australia over four years with no restrictions on work, travel or study for the investor and their family, thereby offering an attractive pathway to Australia.

There are two key people in your application process you need to be comfortable with – the person handling your investment & the person handling your visa application. For an application to be successful, it is important to have a registered migration agent, good communication lines with the Government, a concrete plan for identifying the source of & transfer of funds; as well as understanding the limited time allowed for funds transfer.

Under new SIV investment rules, from Jul 2015, 40% of the $5m must be invested in areas that support innovation through early stage venture capital ($0.5m) & small companies ($1.5m). The balance ($3m) can continue to be invested in Australian managed funds.

We are able to structure investor-specific & tailored solutions. Investors seeking a commercial or compliant investment can choose from a range of businesses or a suite of SIV Funds that meet their risk profile & investment objectives.

We provide advice to wholesale clients, particularly those who may be interested in Australian residency under the 188 Significant Investor Visa 重大投资者签证 (SIV). I conduct educational seminars for corporations & potential clients at various venues to suit their needs & requirements. I work mainly in Sydney, but also from China.

In my financial adviser capacity, I seek an extensive understanding of a client’s situation & objectives to ensure advice is individually tailored to their needs. This includes an assessment of how much risk they need to take to achieve their investment &  cash flow objectives.

My key areas of expertise are in the financial planning & migration disciplines, with a strong focus on strategy formulation; and it is in this area that I advise various high-net-worth clients such as business migrants, executives, charitable foundations & school councils.
 
My financial planning, compliance, responsible manager & significant investor visa experience has given me exposure to many different facets of the financial services industry. My strong work ethic & attention to detail has enabled me to work as an independent financial adviser since 1990. I was an Associate of the Financial Planning Association (FPA) for 20 years, & my company was also a Principal Member of the FPA for 10 years as an Australian Financial Services Licensee (AFSL). My strategic focus, coupled with sound technical knowledge, enables me to provide structured financial advice to wholesale clients, especially those with more complex situations. 

I'm RG146 compliant under the Australian Securities & Investment Commission (ASIC), & I hold the Hong Kong Securities & Investment (HKSI) Institute Exam for Securities & Futures Intermediaries.

We export clean, green food & health products, mainly to China, on behalf of Australian clients. We represent our clients at Trade Shows, both here & abroad. We manage the supply chain, procurement & distribution for clients in Food & Beverage, Health & Beauty and Civil Engineering Services from offices in Sydney & Shanghai.

Our goal is to assist Australian exporters entering & distributing in China. To this end, we have senior contacts in supermarket chains & distributors. We currently deal in edible oils, cleaning products, fresh meat, seafood & baby products; & are seeking well-capitalised Australian clients for expansion in categories such as non-perishable foods, wines, health & skincare products.

Helped manage the supply chain, procurement & distribution for clients in Food &
      
      Beverage and Health & Beauty, from offices in Sydney, Shanghai & Johannesburg.

Open Advice Review Program consultancy involving advice assessment & remediation.
      I was recruited following the sale of my retail financial planning clients to work in the
      Sydney head office as a manager providing advice assessment & remediation for this
      
      program.

We provided private wealth management services dedicated to helping all Australians achieve the financial future they deserve via Home Loans, Financial Planning, Superannuation, Insurance & Savings. 

Almost a third of the home loans written in Sept 2014 by YBR were to Chinese investors ($320m out of $1.1b written – each loan ranging from $350k-$750k). Chinese clients tend to only borrow 50% of the property’s value.

I provided wealth management services under my company name Financial Centres
      Australia. From 1997 to 2006 my company was an AFS Licensee & used Securitor's
      
      licensee services.

I worked in Shanghai for a UK firm advising expatriates, business migrants & Chinese
      nationals. During this period I attended the APAC Private Wealth Management Summit
      held in Macau in Nov 2011 as a representative of my own Sydney based firm, Financial
      
      Centres Australia.

I undertook my initial Financial Services industry training & spent 3 years with Investor
      
      Security Group (now Centric Wealth). I left to form my own company.

I was head hunted to work in Sydney as the executive responsible for new gas project
      
      feasibility studies, marketing & project management.

I was recruited following my MBA to work in the Sydney head office as a manager
      
      servicing corporate banking clients.

I worked in Sydney as a design engineer and project manager responsible for the
      design & implementation of water supply contracts.

I worked in Durban & Johannesburg as a design engineer & project manager on the

general.headline: CPA qualified Registered Tax Agent  | Corporate Tax Advice | SIV Tax Specialist  | Accounting Training and Internships
general.description:
As the Managing Director of Platinum Accounting, I provide accounting advice and services to businesses, corporates, individuals and Significant Investor Visa (SIV) holders across the country.   I am also the Managing Director of Platinum Professional Training, a national training organisation which provides accounting and job preparation training for people seeking to enter, or gain advancement within, the accounting sector in Australia.  We also assist overseas visa holders seeking employment in Australia. 

TRAINING SERVICES

Are you seeking to secure an internship or work experience in the accounting sector?
Would you like to obtain employment in the accounting sector?
Are you in the accounting sector and want to advance further?
Are you an overseas visa holder looking for experience or employment in the Australian accounting sector?

Platinum Professional Training provides training courses in accounting and bookkeeping.  In addition, Platinum also provides work experience in the accounting sector through professional internships.     

ACCOUNTING SERVICES

Are you a business owner looking for the right tax advice?
Are you a Significant Investor Visa (SIV) holder looking for an experienced specialist accountant?

Bad tax planning can lead to an inefficient tax situation which could mean you are paying more tax than required.   The wrong tax advice for your SIV situation could cost you your wealth in Australia, or even your migration application.  

Ideally your business should be structured efficiently so that risk is reduced and your tax situation is maximised.  For SIV holders, you should have a specialist who understands how to maximise your situation that applies to temporary visa holders and foreign tax residents.

I am the Partner of Platinum Accounting Australia, a CPA Public Practice and Registered Tax Agent.  I specialise in corporate tax compliance and SIV accounting.

For advice on corporate tax or SIV matters, email me at:  coco@platinumaccg.com.au

general.headline: Chief Executive Officer, Asia Society Australia
general.description:
Philipp is the CEO of Asia Society Australia and is leading the group through an exciting period of growth and transformation.  Asia Society is the leading global non-profit organisation dedicated to Asia, founded by John D. Rockefeller III in 1956. 

Philipp has an outstanding record of leadership and public service. He is a China specialist with extensive experience in policy and education. Previously, he was a Policy Officer and Manager of the Australia-China Council at the Australian Government’s Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade. Philipp successfully led the renewal of the Council and had broader responsibilities for the bilateral relationship. He was one of the principal authors of the Australia in the Asian Century White Paper - China Country Strategy. 

Previously, he was Acting Director and Deputy Director of the Research Institute for Asia and the Pacific, advised the University of Sydney's Vice-Chancellor on China strategy and managed La Trobe University's partnerships in the Gulf States, Vietnam and Thailand.

Philipp spent over 6 years in China working in education and development. He is the recipient of the ‘Rose Award’ by Shenyang Municipal Government for his contribution to Shenyang City. In 2009 he was awarded the Australian Government’s Endeavour Executive Fellowship to research China's approach to leadership development at the China National Academy of Education Administration. He is a board member of Asia Recon, Australia-Vietnam Young Leadership Dialogue, Haymarket HQ and Sydney City Council's Chinese New Year Advisory Panel. In 2015, he was invited as the only Australian delegate to the 2015 Congress of Vienna - a preeminent global track-two dialogue on major powers conflict, migration, equality and innovation. Philipp is a founder of ‘Disruptive Asia’ - a thought leadership project examining the impact of Asia’s rise on Australia. 

He grew up in Vladivostok on Russia's Pacific coast and is a fluent Chinese and Russian speaker.

jobs.description:
Philipp is an inaugural CEO of the Asia Society (Australia) and is leading the Centre through an exciting period of growth and renewal. 

Asia Society Australia is Australia’s leading national centre for engagement with Asia, based in Sydney.  Asia Society Australia promotes greater connectivity and deeper understanding between Australia and Asia in the areas of business, policy, culture and education. We provide a high-level and innovative platform for Australian and Asian leaders and champions of engagement to connect, exchange ideas and develop meaningful relationships.

Asia Recon is a program set up to help foster, develop and build Australia's
      engagement across the technology, innovation and entrepreneurial sector within Asia

jobs.description:
The Australia-ASEAN Emerging Leaders Program (A2ELP) is a program coinciding with and including attendance at the Asia-Pacific Roundtable. Now in its 4th year, the A2ELP in 2014 is facilitated by The Asia Foundation alongside the 28th Asia-Pacific Roundtable that is convened annually by ISIS Malaysia.

The program brings together inspiring young leaders from Australia and South East Asia, representing the government, non-government, corporate, and media sectors, and exposes them to high-level discussions on contemporary issues; provides a forum to develop their understanding of regional issues and capacity as regional leaders; and builds long-term, productive linkages with each other and with the region's leading thinkers and specialists.

The AIYD is a formal dialogue between the youth of Australia and India. The AIYD believes that whilst constructive activities have historically taken place between both countries, such activities have generally been carried out in an ad hoc manner. The establishment of the AIYD will provide a sustainable platform for the young leaders of Australia and India to come together and foster a strong partnership between the two countries. Gonul was one of the fifteen Australian delegates in the 2013 program.

Responsible for the development and implementation of a specific Trade Engagement
      
      Program with India to boost two way trade and collaboration.

general.headline: Managing Director, Global Business College of Australia
general.description:
I am a President, Deputy Chair, Committee Member and Managing Director with board level experience and entrepreneurial expertise, in the business and education sectors. My recent years of experience as an executive director and board member has equipped me with a concrete understanding of the governance practices in Australia. 

I manage a portfolio of commercial properties in the Melbourne CBD and surrounding areas. 

As Managing Director of the Global Business College of Australia, I oversaw the establishment and development of the college from its inception. I played a vital role in the partnership with the University of Canberra (UC) in co-delivering UC bachelor programs in Commerce and IT in Melbourne, with other disciplines and master programs scheduled for the near future.  

I played a key role in organizing the 26th edition International Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence (IJCAI) in 2017 in Melbourne. As the Local Financial Chair, we have attracted sponsorship support of over AUD900,000 from the Victorian government and more than 40 multinational organizations. 

Some of other achievements include:
•      Participated in the G20 Summit as a member of the Business 20 Forum (B20) Employment and Education Task Force for the past 2 years, providing constructive policy recommendations to G20 leaders in addressing global education and workforce gaps
•      As a chief investigator, I led GBCA in partnering with the University of Technology Sydney (UTS) and Australia Research Alliance for Children and Youth for a 3-year ARC (Australian Research Council) Project, on the topic of ‘Cyberbullying Prevention and Detection Systems’, which received a government grant of $550,000.
•	Collaborated with CLPS, a global IT and Fintech service provider in establishing a Financial Innovation Centre in GBCA, introducing the Virtual Banking Training Platform to students.

jobs.companyName: China Chamber of Commerce in Australia, Victoria Chapter
jobs.jobTitle: Deputy Secretary General and Board Member
jobs.description:
Founded in 2006, China Chamber of Commerce in Australia, Victoria Chapter(CCCA), actively promotes bilateral business, trade and investment between Australian and China. CCCA Melbourne currently consists of approximately 60 large corporate members, including the big three banks in China, ICBC, CCB and Bank of China, and other distinguished companies such as CITIC, Huawei, China Southern Airlines, Hisense Australia, COSCO Oceania Chartering, Golden Age, Fu Wah Australia etc. covering multiple sectors including finance, property, tourism, media, energy, telecommunication, mining etc. 

As the most prestigious representative organization of Chinese business community in Victoria, CCCA Melbourne has played an important role in enabling dialogues and deepening bilateral relationships between two countries, by working collectively with government and industry to build upon mutual trust and synergies for the benefit of both countries and their people. 

CCCA Melbourne has initiated and facilitated numerous significant commercial and consulting activities to strengthen the Australia-China partnership including:
• Establishing a platform for large SOE and private Chinese organizations in Victoria to exchange ideas and collaborate as well as interact and cooperate with local government, corporations and companies
• Organizing a series of forum on a range of topics such as ChAFTA and the ‘One Belt, One Road’ initiative, to promote Sino-Australian relationships and partnerships

jobs.description:
Hainan University is ranked in the top 100 Universities amongst 2000 Public
      Universities in China and I have been providing insights and resources into the
      
      international strategy and development of the University.

The Business 20 (B20) is an essential part of the Group of 20 (G20) process, the premium forum facilitating international economic collaboration and inclusive global governance. Developed under the theme “Building Resilience – Improving Sustainability – Assuming Responsibility’, the B20 represents the business communities of the G20 countries, in initiating policy recommendations to G20 leaders that lead to sustainable global economy growth.

The focus of the forum as been employment and education and working with the B20 Employment and Education Task Force to develop recommendations to address global education and workforce gaps, with a focus on promoting open, dynamic and comprehensive labor markets, harnessing technological changes and creating a globalized platform to achieve a future-oriented and sustainable world economy.

jobs.jobTitle: Committee Member & Deputy Chair of Education and Training Working Group (Victoria)
jobs.description:
As a member of the Education Working Group, I:
●	Lead and initiate innovation in the education and training sector in both Australia and China
●	Organize workshops, seminars and forums to exchange ideas with educators and government agencies. The most recent event was the 2017 ACBC Education forum, which attracted more than 130 participants from the education sector and Federal and Victorian government departments to share their insights and experience.

GBCA is a nationally recognised registered training organisation and the scope offerings consists of vocational programs, non-award and executive programs, Huawei accredited courses, projects and collaborations with Victorian Government and Australian universities. Currently, GBCA is also preparing to apply for approval to become a higher education provider to offer programs in the fields of Business and Information Technology.

GBCA is an innovative branch of an international education group, with over 39,000 students and with headquarters in Guangzhou City, China. The group delivers training at diversified levels of education, including higher education (over 22,000 students at Guangdong University of Finance and Economics Huashang College), vocational education and training, and early childhood education.

In this role I lead a team of 50 staff and am:
●	Playing a key leading role in the setting up and development of a new business college in Melbourne, jointly established by the University of Canberra and GBCA, commencing operation in February 2017, including curriculum development and staff recruitment.
●	Responsible for overseeing applications for registration and accreditation with relevant State and Federal authorities for the offering of various courses to students in Australia and from overseas.
●	Responsible for overseeing the design, and construction of new facilities, learning spaces, and administration offices in a custom-designed teaching and learning environment.

jobs.companyName: Australia-China Association of Scientists and Entrepreneurs (ACASE)
jobs.description:
Founder of the Association of more than 760 scientists and entrepreneurs. Significant achievements include:

●	Whilst President, initiated and facilitated the first Melbourne sub-division “Chunhui Cup” competition, a prestigious and influential entrepreneurial national level competition in China, organized and hosted by the Ministry of Education of the People’s Republic of China and Ministry of Science and Technology of the People’s Republic of China. This annual competition commenced in 2006, covering areas in biomedicine, IT, resources and environments, energy efficiency, agricultural science technology and other related fields. There have since been over 120 participants selected for the innovative entrepreneurship program, with 20 participants successfully embarking on the entrepreneurship pathway.
●	Contributed to the partnership with Suzhou High-tech Venture Capital Group to set up parallel angel fund of approximately AUD20 million.

●	Led and initiated the bridging of academic and business collaborative partnerships between China and Australia, as well as accelerating knowledge and talent exchange, industry-relevant scientific research, and growing the Australia-China relationship further.
●	Led “Academic and Business Mission” trips to China including business matching meetings and industrial/laboratory site visits, which resulted in commercialization funds and Sino-Australian collaborations
●	Hosted high level talent recruitment's campaigns for approximately 50 Chinese Universities, Academic Institutions and Government Organizations.
●	Led the delivery of The annual flagship Research Symposium event organized by CAPS. The 8th CAPS Symposium held in 2014, attracted over 250 participants including Consul General, Mr. Yumin Song, the Consulate-General of the P.R. China in Melbourne; Prof. John Dewar, VC and President of La Trobe University and many academic experts from universities and research organizations across Australia and China.

In this role I:
●	Contributed to organizing China-related projects, managing and working in a collaborative team, developing international academic/business cooperation and linkages with Chinese government bodies, universities, and financial institutions.
●	Assisted with the development of new international programs (in education cooperation and executive development) with a specific focus on costing and budgeting.

general.headline: CEO at Bastion China
general.school: University of International Business and Economics
general.description:
Tom Parker is a China specialist with a focus on collaboration between Australia and China to broaden our bi-lateral relationship.  A Mandarin speaker, Tom’s long term engagement with China has resulted in impressive networks and successful business outcomes. He has held China focused roles in The Asialink Centre, Austrade (Beijing), City of Melbourne and as writer and reporter for the ABC in both China and Australia for Radio National’s Asia Pacific Program. 

Tom has managed programs and facilitated business and government partnerships in China for the City of Melbourne including raising the profile of the Melbourne-Tianjin Sister City relationship and recently leading the business delegation for the NSW Premier’s China Mission.  In 2007, Tom was keynote speaker at the CPA China Summit, and regularly delivers intercultural training programs for multinational clients in Australia and China including: the Australian Football League, AMP, Intrepid Travel , Lonely Planet, Morgan Stanley, FDI and the Melbourne Football Club.

Tom incorporates a life-long passion for China into his professional life having studied Chinese (Mandarin) since 1987.  He has completed a Bachelor of Arts (Asian Studies) with honours from Melbourne University and the Australian National University and a Graduate Diploma of International Business Studies (in Mandarin) at the University of International Business and Economics in Beijing.  Tom has also studied in the Advanced Chinese Language Program at the East China Normal University in Shanghai. 

Tom is a well connected Australia-China facilitator with extensive experience assisting business and government better understand and access their opportunities in China.

Specialties: Access to China Market and networks 
Understanding how to engage, interact and succeed in China 
Influence in shaping your China strategy 
Cultural Intelligence - helping manage diversity and work across national boundaries in today's globalised reality

general.headline: CEO of StartCon | Startup Mentor
general.description:
About me: I am innovative and I work hard for the things I'm passionate about. I love meeting new people and learning new things. I am a problem solver and entrepreneur at heart. I believe that life is about the people you meet and the things you create with them. I come from a background of technology and internet companies, so my work experience is centered around digital marketing. I know how to measure and drive results with limited resources, and I strive to make things possible even in the face of uncertainty.

Bio:
Cheryl Mack is currently the Head of StartCon (a Freelancer.com company). She hosts the largest startup and growth event in Australia, with over 3000 attendees and featuring huge-name speakers from the world’s biggest technology companies. She sits on the Program Advisory Committee for the City of Sydney’s Tech Startups Action Plan. Cheryl is also an active mentor for young entrepreneurs. 
 
Cheryl has hosted over 200 talks with successful founders, investors, and industry experts in Canada, the US & Australia. Currently seeking refuge in Sydney, Australia, after escaping from the Canadian Asylum for the Mentally Gifted, Cheryl previously founded the Startup Grind Vancouver, creating video episodes with people such as Eric Migicovsky (Founder @ Pebble Watches), Boris Wertz (Board Partner @ Andreessen Horowitz), and Dan Martell (Founder @ Clarity.fm). Early in her career, Cheryl held key marketing management roles at Gauge Mobile (acquired by Juice Mobile), and iCompass Technologies where she was responsible for new channel revenue growth of 200% YOY.
 
Cheryl graduated from the University of British Columbia, with a Bachelor of Commerce and Marketing. In her lifetime, she has lived and worked in startup ecosystems in Canada, Europe, the US, and Australia, she plans to continue helping startups around the world in a mission to grow them into global companies.

Open to: collaboration, pitches, advice, connections, or a chat over 20 thousand beers.

general.headline: President at Australia China Business Circle

jobs.description:
《澳中商圈》是集月刊Magazine，网站Website，微信WeChat，邮件简报Newsletter ，优酷Youku，LinkedIn六大传播途径为一体的综合媒体传播平台，以中英双语的形式，对准中澳两国愿意相互投资合作的高端精英群体。
AUSTRALIA CHINA BUSINESS CIRCLE is an integrated media communications platform consisting of 6 major broadcast channels: a monthly magazine, website, WeChat, Newsletter, Youku and LinkedIn in Chinese and English.  It is for the mutual benefit of Chinese and Australian investment partnerships specifically designed for our high-wealth community.   

《澳中商圈》为彩色铜版豪华月刊，独家原创，高端设计，全澳发行，本土出品；以中文发布澳洲主流信息，让中国投资人群认识澳洲；用英文传递中国权威资讯，使澳洲主流社会了解中国。《澳中商圈》杂志以数个先锋栏目统领“财富”、“时尚”、“品味”三大板块。

AUSTRALIA CHINA BUSINESS CIRCLE is an exclusive monthly publication, independent and original.   The design is high-end, distributed throughout Australia and locally produced.     We publish mainstream Australian news and interviews in Chinese about entrepreneurs and companies , allowing Chinese investor groups to understand Australia; and as a means for Australians to better understand the Chinese investor’s mentality.    AUSTRALIA CHINA BUSINESS CIRCLE magazine features three main sections: “Fortune”; “Fashion” and “Lifestyle”. 

《澳中商圈》隶属于彼岸国际集团。 彼岸国际集团搭建立体“中澳商圈”——以全方位的服务媒体服务+品牌和项目包装推广+组织或承接活动+移民和投资咨询为综合体，成为澳洲主流社会和中国投资者的桥梁。

AUSTRALIA CHINA BUSINESS CIRCLE is part of the AC Bridge International Group.   It was created to provide comprehensive media services, brand promotion and events as well as tailoring packaged solutions for investors and projects.   We offer integrated immigration and investment advice; providing a bridge between Chinese investment and Australian society.

jobs.jobTitle: Director at Managing Your Message, Journalist, Facilitator, MC, Public Speaker
jobs.description:
Naomi Robson became well known to the Australian public as a news reporter on Seven News from1991,  and during her ten years as presenter of Today Tonight - a public affairs program on the Seven Network which moved up the rankings to become the Number 1 program in its time slot during her tenure as anchor – from early 1997 to the end of 2006.

Since 2008, Naomi has been the Director of, and primary trainer at, Managing Your Message - a company that provides customised Media Training, Sales & Presentation Skills training courses, Media Crisis Management and Media Consultation to a wide variety of companies. 

Naomi is passionate about assisting companies, CEOs, senior executives and Sales and Marketing Teams to communicate effectively with genuine and credible influence and impact.

In terms of Presentation Skills, MYM runs specifically tailored workshops that cover all the elements of Presenting - Content and Construction of key messages (in line with the company’s brand strategy), Story-telling, Delivery, Engagement, Body Language, Voice, Controlling Nerves and Mindset.

Naomi, has trained numerous CEOs, the executive team at Myer under Bernie Brookes and ANZ Private's Relationship Managers, she provides presentation skills workshops for NAB’S Board Ready Program, and has worked with PwC, CVA Property Consultants, BIC, The Heat Group and a host of other clients in varying industries, from legal firms, financial advisors, sporting entities, truck companies, and media organisations, to the Young Presidents' Organisation, World Presidents' Organisation and the Entrepreneurs' Organisation, to mention just a few. 

In addition, Naomi ran Media Training and Presentation Skills courses for the prestigious Monash University Executive MBA Program for four years.

She also provides communications consulting to companies engaged in IPO activities. Naomi is available to MC or host conferences, and act as an interviewer or facilitator for events or conferences.

Little Frog Productions runs Managing Your Message - which provides corporations and executives with media training courses and presentations skills workshops... as well as producing corporate DVDs and videos.

Little Frog Productions has been providing corporate media and presentation skills training since 2007 but rebranded the training arm of the business as Managing Your Message, in August 2010.

jobs.description:
George Wang is the founding CEO and Chairman of AIMS Financial Group and an active participant in both the Australian and Chinese financial services industries.

George came to Australia from China at the end of 1988 and founded AIMS 2 years later. George has developed an extensive business network in both Australia and China. He is an advisor for a number of Chinese Government bodies and agencies. George is the President of the Australia-China Finance & Investment Council.

Established in 1991, AIMS is a diversified financial services and investment group, active in the areas of lending, securitisation, investment banking, funds management , properties investment, stockbroker and stock exchange ownership.

During the GFC , AIMS expanded its business in a time when many other businesses were experieincing immense difficulties.

In October 2008, AIMS acquired and fully owned the Asia Pacific Stock Exchange (APX), now change to Sydney Stock exchange.

In August 2009, AIMS acquired the ASX listing Fund Manager -MacarthurCook(MCK) with A$1.1 Billion under management . MCK had four listing funds, two listing in ASX , one listing in SGX and other listing in NYSE. MCK also have 9 un-list funds.

In May 2015, AIMS acquired BBY. BBY was the largest independent full service stockbroker in Australia and New Zealand , BBY has over A$2 billion in assets under administration and have over A$7billion worth of completed capital raisings. BBY has renamed to APP Securities .

AIMS has raised about AUD 4 Billion in funds from the capital markets. AIMS issued about AUD 3 Billion RMBS with most of them rated AAA by both S&P and Fitch Ratings, and has originated A$8billion of mortgage.

AIMS AMP capital Reits listing in singapore stock exchange with assets S$1.5billion.

general.headline: Australia China Connections
general.description:
My company, Australia China Connections is providing a service to Australian companies assisting in China Business Development.The service focuses primarily on the first stage when considering doing business with the local Chinese market or in China, which starts in your local office.

Whether you are considering to export your products or services, or do inbound business from China, the challenge is the same – ‘Is your company China Ready’?

To have an understanding of and ability to tolerate Chinese culture relating to business,can make or break your results when dealing with China.

Having suitable Chinese speaking staff at your office is an imperative, and an understanding of China as a country and some of its history will improve your results.

Our China Business Development program incorporates the following:

• Analysis of your ‘China Ready’ needs.
• Teaching and training management and staff in cultural diversity.
• Understanding the complexity of China and its people.
• Recruiting and training suitable local Chinese employees.
• Providing suitable connections with and in China to develop China business.
• Ongoing support to grow your inbound or outbound business with China.
• Export Market Development Grant processing assistance.

The service is provided by Carl Jetter, who has 12 years of active understanding and experience with China.

In my former role as publisher of Australia China Connections for 12 twelve years I acquired the knowhow of living and understanding business with Chinese people.

In my previous role as board member of the Australia China Business Council Vic, as well as eight years as Councilor with the City of Melbourne, it enabled me to build a host of valuable connections of benefit to assist others.

I now train and assist local Chinese graduates to understand cultural diversity, and support their need to find employment.

Chief HR Officer for the NSW Transport Cluster which consists of 25,000 staff across five agencies.

• Exercised  network and branch leadership skills to design and deliver an ongoing comprehensive strategic People Plan  via a HR team of 120 FTE.

general.headline: Deputy Executive Director Customer Delivery at Sydney Trains
general.description:
A results oriented executive leader with over 20 years experience leading geographically dispersed, multi-disciplinary teams in high volume customer service work streams across the telecommunications and transportation industries. These environments have been characterised by aggressive industrial intervention, rapid technological development, operational and regulatory complexity.

A proven track record of successfully leading organisational transformation across people and process, the ability to inspire innovative and creative thinking in a collaborative environment, and the ability to oversee the delivery of first class business aligned technology solutions.

Passionate about working with leaders and teams alike, to find ways to understand and unlock potential, deepen self-awareness, improve productivity and employee engagement and achieve outstanding results.

KEY STRENGTHS

	The ability to develop and operationalise customer service strategy.
	A proven capacity to demonstrate accountability and deliver results.
	Inspirational leadership in managing and developing people.
	A personal brand readily identified in the workplace for trust, respect and integrity.
	A clear and engaging communicator with an ability to connect across all levels of an organisation.

jobs.description:
Oversee the delivery of customer service across 74 stations in the Sydney Trains
      
      network involving responsibility for 950 staff

Responsibilities

Lead the development of strategies programs and initiatives for the provision of clear, accurate and timely transport information to enhance the customer experience.

Develop insight and customer intelligence gathered from the operational management of teams engaged with customers via multiple communication channels including social media, customer satisfaction surveys, customer feedback and independent verification.

Operating Expense: $40 million
Capital Expense: $30 million 
Staff: 90

Achievements

Successfully led the development of the Customer Service Mobility Strategy and its subsequent implementation including the deployment of smart phones and associated customised applications to 1500 frontline customer service staff. This has allowed staff to free themselves of computers in back-office areas, increase their visible presence with our customers on station platforms and supported an overall increase in customer satisfaction from 78% in 2013 to 90% in 2016.

Developed and delivered the Customer Information Channel Management Strategy and its subsequent implementation via the Customer Information Program, a $20m annual capital program designed to ensure Sydney Trains systems can meet customer information needs. 

Led the management of Customer Feedback and Complaint Handling for Sydney Trains and NSW trains, including the processing of 40,000 items of customer feedback each year.

Led the Customer Experience Management program on behalf of Sydney Trains including management of an external vendor undertaking 250 independent verification and mystery shopping interventions across 178 locations each fortnight, the delivery of qualitative and quantitative KPI reporting, and the development and deployment of automated self service tools that allow users to extract customised reports.

Responsible for the leadership, management and performance of 1,500 train crew
      
      operating in a continuous 24 hour shift-work cycle through 10 direct reports.

- Lead the delivery of customer service for a geographical area comprising 180 staff operating at 14 locations through 10 direct reports.

- Undertake hands-on customer relationship management including community liaison and consultation with local stakeholder groups, state and federal politicians, state government statutory authorities, transport user groups, local council representatives, emergency services, disability service providers and technology vendors.

Lead a nationally dispersed operations team of business analysts, process specialists
      and project managers to identify, define and implement business improvement and
      
      process standardisation opportunities across 6 customer contact centres and 500 staff.

Halcyon Knights is Australia's highest-performing IT&T Executive Search firm. We don't subscribe to rhetoric; we are committed to delivering results.

For employers - we genuinely secure you a competitive advantage through people. We are humble, versatile, disciplined and methodical. We are tenacious and look under every rock and if at first we don't succeed (in generating the interest of a passive candidate) we try again. We are well-researched and intelligent and we represent your business and employment opportunities respectfully, positively and accurately.

For candidates - we don't waste time. We manage your expectations up front and we are highly visible and accessible. We don't build false hope and then go missing. We are prepared to identify and market your transferable skills - we don't just look for a square peg for a square hole. We educate our clients on why you should be considered and we build a compelling case for your consideration.

For employees - we are Australia's highest-performing IT&T Executive Search firm. We have the mentality that success breeds success - we expect no less. We empower our people and tolerate mistakes if you're trying; but we don't like losing. We have a heap of fun and don't take ourselves too seriously. We have a propensity to smile. We get out of work what we put into it.

general.description:
With 20 years' experience in Executive Search and Selection, I most recently joined Transport for NSW as Executive Talent Specialist to continue developing my end to end Executive Talent Sourcing skill base. 

I have spent the past 15 years recruiting across multiple disciplines including Human Resources, Accounting and Finance, Sales & Marketing, On Line Education, Engineering, Architecture, Business Support and Hospitality. My experience includes recruiting permanent and contracting professionals across multiple industry sectors. 

I have in-depth knowledge of the trends and issues affecting the Talent Acquisition arena and enables me to provide added value to my business partners and candidates.

I possess a wealth of knowledge in how to source and retain talented people who have the capabilities and vision to add strategic value to the management and growth of the business.

jobs.description:
At Transport, our vision is for a truly integrated transport system that will meet the needs of our customers now and into the future. The Transport portfolio includes Transport for NSW as principal agency with Sydney Trains, NSW Trains, State Transit Authority and Roads and Maritime Services as our key operating agencies.

We are a values based organisation and employ the most talented people to work together to deliver services for our customers and make NSW a better place to live, do business and visit.

TfNSW are committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture across the Transport cluster, planning for and promoting diversity. We welcome and encourage applications from diverse community groups and ages including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander, LGBTI, people with disabilities, women and other diversity groups. TfNSW recognises the benefits that such an approach brings for our staff and customers in delivering the future of NSW.

Open Colleges has been providing life changing education for over 100 years, and is Australia’s leader in online education. So far, we’ve have helped over 800,000 students gain the skills to launch, change or take the next step in their careers.

We offer over 100 online courses, including nationally recognised qualifications, in the areas of Business and Management, Finance and Accounting, Education, Community Services, Healthcare, Animal Care, Beauty, Fitness, Design, Science, Technology and Trades.

We’ve built a team that’s dedicated to delivering an exceptional student experience and we couldn’t be prouder that we get to play a part in helping our students change their lives through education.

Open Colleges are part of Apollo Education Group, Inc. With over half a million current learners across eight countries, Apollo Education Group is one of the world’s largest education providers.

Reporting to the Head of People and Culture, I am responsible for ensuring that Open Colleges attracts highly engaged and committed professionals to join the Open Colleges team. This is achieved by providing professional support and advising managers on best practice recruitment and selection. 

I develop and implement recruitment policies, processes and tools to assist Open Colleges recruit high-achieving employees across every division during a period of unprecedented growth which has resulted in hiring over 500 professionals in my tenure with Open Colleges. I recruit across the following divisions -  Education, Course Development & Design, Digital Marketing, IT Systems, Sales (B2C & B2B), Finance, Call Centre, Contact Centre, Compliance & Regulation and Human Resources.

Currently working with Hannaford Ross Search & Selection, experts in Recruitment Industry talent.  
I am responsible for the sourcing, management and utilisation of candidates within the recruitment sector through the creation of talent pipelines and pool management for key skill sets in the recruitment sector nationally. 
Contact me for a confidential discussion on your next career move on 0403 082 647.

general.headline: Associate Director at Paras and Partners Executive Search and Selection  +61423 789 789
general.company: Paras and Partners Executive Search and Selection
general.description:
Paras & Partners Executive Search and Selection provides recruitment services in the pharmaceutical and healthcare industry. Our team of industry experienced consultants and researchers hold an exceptional track record in delivering recruitment solutions to clients across the globe.
 
Our areas of expertise includes Sales and Marketing, Medical, Regulatory Affairs, Pharmacovigilance and Research and Development. Paras & Partners Executive Search and Selection are a wholly owned Australian company. Our head office is based in Melbourne and our state offices are in Sydney, Brisbane and Perth.

jobs.companyName: Paras and Partners Executive Search and Selection
jobs.description:
Based in Melbourne, I have been providing specialised recruitment services to the ANZ Healthcare market since 2007. 

After graduating with a Double Major Degree in Science, majoring in Biochemistry and  Chemistry  I commenced my career in the pharmaceutical industry 1996. Working for a leading, global, R&D based pharmaceutical company I started out as a GP Representative and later moved in Hospital Specialist and followed on in Sales Management.   
Paras and Partners executive search and selection was established in 2012 and provides recruitment services across the Pharmaceutical, Medical Device and Biotechnology sectors. Our team of industry experienced consultants and researchers being with them a successful track record in delivering recruitment solutions across all functions including, Sales and Marketing, Medical, Regulatory affairs, Clinical, Pharmacovigilance and Business Support. 
Our consultants and researchers are also from the Healthcare industry  and bring with them a proven track record in delivering recruitment solutions across the Healthcare and Pharmaceutical Sector. We adopt a proven model which is underpinned by strong research capability and a comprehensive database.  To achieve success, we are aware that it takes determination, skill and strong ethics to deliver successful outcomes to our clients and candidates. We work strategically to develop a tailored process to achieve our client's desired results. We pride ourselves on our search capabilities that specialise in the Healthcare and Pharmaceutical Industry from entry level to CEO's.
Through many years in healthcare recruitment I have developed a broad network of both candidates and client companies and a thorough understanding of what it takes to be successful in this industry.
